# CupertinoTextField

An iOS-style text field.

A text field lets the user enter text, either with hardware keyboard or with an onscreen keyboard.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/input/cupertinotextfield)

### Basic textfields[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#basic-textfields "Direct link to Basic textfields")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    page.add(        ft.TextField(            label="Material",        ),        ft.CupertinoTextField(            placeholder_text="Placeholder",        ),        ft.TextField(            adaptive=True,            label="Adaptive",        ),    )ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield/img/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield/basic-cupertino-textfield.png)

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `animate_cursor_opacity`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#animate_cursor_opacity "Direct link to animate_cursor_opacity")

Whether the cursor will animate from fully transparent to fully opaque during each cursor blink.

Defaults to `True` on iOS platforms and `False` on Android platforms.

### `autocorrect`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#autocorrect "Direct link to autocorrect")

Whether to enable autocorrection.

Defaults to `True`.

### `autofill_hints`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#autofill_hints "Direct link to autofill_hints")

Helps the autofill service identify the type of this text input. Value can either be a single [`AutoFillHint`](/docs/reference/types/autofillhint) enum item or a list of them.

More information [here](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/cupertino/CupertinoTextField/autofillHints.html).

### `autofocus`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#autofocus "Direct link to autofocus")

True if the control will be selected as the initial focus. If there is more than one control on a page with autofocus set, then the first one added to the page will get focus.

### `bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#bgcolor "Direct link to bgcolor")

TextField background [color](/docs/reference/colors).

### `blend_mode`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#blend_mode "Direct link to blend_mode")

The blend mode applied to the `color` or `gradient` background.

Value is of type [`BlendMode`](/docs/reference/types/blendmode) and defaults to `BlendMode.MODULATE`.

### `border`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#border "Direct link to border")

A border to draw around input.

Value is of type [`Border`](/docs/reference/types/border).

### `border_color`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#border_color "Direct link to border_color")

Border [color](/docs/reference/colors). Could be `transparent` to hide the border.

### `border_radius`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#border_radius "Direct link to border_radius")

Value is of type [`BorderRadius`](/docs/reference/types/borderradius).

### `can_reveal_password`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#can_reveal_password "Direct link to can_reveal_password")

Displays a toggle icon button that allows revealing the entered password. Is shown if both `password` and `can_reveal_password` are `True`.

The icon is displayed in the same location as `suffix` and in case both `can_reveal_password`/`password` and `suffix` are provided, then the `suffix` is not shown.

### `capitalization`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#capitalization "Direct link to capitalization")

Enables automatic on-the-fly capitalization of entered text.

Value is of type [`TextCapitalization`](/docs/reference/types/textcapitalization) and defaults to `TextCapitalization.NONE`.

### `clear_button_semantics_label`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#clear_button_semantics_label "Direct link to clear_button_semantics_label")

The semantic label for the clear button used by screen readers. This will be used by screen reading software to identify the clear button widget.

Defaults to `"Clear"`.

### `clear_button_visibility_mode`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#clear_button_visibility_mode "Direct link to clear_button_visibility_mode")

Defines the visibility of the clear button based on the state of text entry. Will appear only if no `suffix` is provided.

Value is of type [`VisibilityMode`](/docs/reference/types/visibilitymode) and defaults to `VisibilityMode.NEVER`.

### `clip_behavior`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#clip_behavior "Direct link to clip_behavior")

The content will be clipped (or not) according to this option.

Value is of type [`ClipBehavior`](/docs/reference/types/clipbehavior) and defaults to `ClipBehavior.HARD_EDGE`.

### `color`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#color "Direct link to color")

Text [color](/docs/reference/colors).

### `content_padding`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#content_padding "Direct link to content_padding")

The padding for the input decoration's container.

The value is an instance of [`Padding`](/docs/reference/types/padding) class or a number.

### `cursor_color`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#cursor_color "Direct link to cursor_color")

The cursor's [color](/docs/reference/colors).

### `cursor_height`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#cursor_height "Direct link to cursor_height")

The cursor's height.

### `cursor_radius`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#cursor_radius "Direct link to cursor_radius")

The radius of the cursor's corners.

By default, the cursor has no radius.

### `cursor_width`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#cursor_width "Direct link to cursor_width")

Sets cursor width.

### `dense`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#dense "Direct link to dense")

Whether the TextField is part of a dense form (ie, uses less vertical space).

### `enable_ime_personalized_learning`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#enable_ime_personalized_learning "Direct link to enable_ime_personalized_learning")

Whether to enable that the IME update personalized data such as typing history and user dictionary data.

Has effect only on Android devices.

Defaults to `True`.

### `enable_interactive_selection`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#enable_interactive_selection "Direct link to enable_interactive_selection")

Whether to enable user interface affordances for changing the text selection.

For example, setting this to true will enable features such as long-pressing the text field to select text and show the cut/copy/paste menu, and tapping to move the text caret.

When `False`, the user cannot adjust the text selection, copy text, and paste clipboard content into the text field.

Defaults to true.

### `enable_scrible`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#enable_scrible "Direct link to enable_scrible")

Whether iOS 14 Scribble features are enabled. Has effect only on iPads.

Defaults to `True`.

### `enable_suggestions`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#enable_suggestions "Direct link to enable_suggestions")

Whether to show input suggestions as the user types.

This flag only affects Android. On iOS, suggestions are tied directly to `autocorrect`, so that suggestions are only shown when `autocorrect` is `True`. On Android autocorrection and suggestion are controlled separately.

Defaults to `True`.

### `filled`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#filled "Direct link to filled")

If `True` the decoration's container is filled with theme fill color.

### `fit_parent_size`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#fit_parent_size "Direct link to fit_parent_size")

Whether the field's height should expand to fill its parent.

When `True`, the `min_lines` and `max_lines` properties are ignored.

Defaults to `False`.

### `focused_bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#focused_bgcolor "Direct link to focused_bgcolor")

Background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of TextField in focused state.

### `focused_border_color`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#focused_border_color "Direct link to focused_border_color")

Border [color](/docs/reference/colors) in focused state.

### `focused_border_width`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#focused_border_width "Direct link to focused_border_width")

Border width in focused state.

### `focused_color`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#focused_color "Direct link to focused_color")

Text [color](/docs/reference/colors) when TextField is focused.

### `gradient`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#gradient "Direct link to gradient")

Configures gradient background.

Value is of type [`Gradient`](/docs/reference/types/gradient).

### `image`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#image "Direct link to image")

An image to paint above the `bgcolor` or `gradient`.

Value is of type [`DecorationImage`](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage).

### `input_filter`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#input_filter "Direct link to input_filter")

Provides as-you-type filtering/validation in your `TextField`.

Value is of type [`InputFilter`](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter).

### `keyboard_brightness`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#keyboard_brightness "Direct link to keyboard_brightness")

The appearance of the keyboard.

Has effect only on iOS devices.

Value is of type [`Brightness`](/docs/reference/types/brightness) and defaults to `Brightness.LIGHT`.

### `keyboard_type`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#keyboard_type "Direct link to keyboard_type")

The type of keyboard to use for editing the text.

Value is of type [`KeyboardType`](/docs/reference/types/keyboardtype) and defaults to `KeyboardType.TEXT`.

### `max_length`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#max_length "Direct link to max_length")

Limits a maximum number of characters that can be entered into CupertinoTextField.

### `max_lines`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#max_lines "Direct link to max_lines")

The maximum number of lines to show at one time, wrapping if necessary. This affects the height of the field itself and does not limit the number of lines that can be entered into the field.

If this is `1` (the default), the text will not wrap, but will scroll horizontally instead.

Has no effect when `fit_parent_size` is `True`.

### `min_lines`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#min_lines "Direct link to min_lines")

The minimum number of lines to occupy when the content spans fewer lines. This affects the height of the field itself and does not limit the number of lines that can be entered into the field.

Has no effect when `fit_parent_size` is `True`.

Defaults to `1`.

### `multiline`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#multiline "Direct link to multiline")

`True` if TextField can contain multiple lines of text.

### `obscuring_character`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#obscuring_character "Direct link to obscuring_character")

Character to use when obscuring text if `password` is `True`.

Defaults to `•`.

### `padding`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#padding "Direct link to padding")

The padding around the text entry area between the `prefix` and `suffix` or the clear button when `clear_button_mode` is not `VisibilityMode.NEVER`.

Value is of type [`Padding`](/docs/reference/types/padding) and defaults to padding of `7` pixels on all sides.

### `password`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#password "Direct link to password")

Whether to hide the text being edited.

Defaults to `False`.

### `placeholder_text`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#placeholder_text "Direct link to placeholder_text")

A lighter colored placeholder hint that appears on the first line of the text field when the text entry is empty. Defaults to an empty string.

### `placeholder_style`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#placeholder_style "Direct link to placeholder_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for `placeholder_text`.

### `prefix`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#prefix "Direct link to prefix")

Optional `Control` to place on the line before the input.

### `prefix_visibility_mode`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#prefix_visibility_mode "Direct link to prefix_visibility_mode")

Defines the visibility of the `prefix` control based on the state of text entry. Has no effect if `prefix` is not specified.

Value is of type [`VisibilityMode`](/docs/reference/types/visibilitymode) and defaults to `VisibilityMode.ALWAYS`.

### `read_only`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#read_only "Direct link to read_only")

Whether the text can be changed.

When this is set to `True`, the text cannot be modified by any shortcut or keyboard operation. The text is still selectable.

Defaults to `False`.

### `rtl`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#rtl "Direct link to rtl")

`True` to set text direction to right-to-left.

Default is `False`.

### `scroll_padding`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#scroll_padding "Direct link to scroll_padding")

Defines the paddint surrounding this field when scrolled.

Value is of type [`Padding`](/docs/reference/types/padding) and defaults to padding of `20` pixels on all sides.

### `selection_color`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#selection_color "Direct link to selection_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) of TextField selection.

### `shadow`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#shadow "Direct link to shadow")

A list of shadows behind the text field.

### `shift_enter`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#shift_enter "Direct link to shift_enter")

Changes the behavior of `Enter` button in `multiline` TextField to be chat-like, i.e. new line can be added with `Shift`+`Enter` and pressing just `Enter` fires `on_submit` event.

### `show_cursor`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#show_cursor "Direct link to show_cursor")

Whether the field's cursor is to be shown.

Defaults to `True`.

### `smart_dashes_type`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#smart_dashes_type "Direct link to smart_dashes_type")

Whether to allow the platform to automatically format dashes.

This flag only affects iOS versions 11 and above. As an example of what this does, two consecutive hyphen characters will be automatically replaced with one en dash, and three consecutive hyphens will become one em dash. Default is `True`.

### `smart_quotes_type`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#smart_quotes_type "Direct link to smart_quotes_type")

Whether to allow the platform to automatically format quotes.

This flag only affects iOS. As an example of what this does, a standard vertical double quote character will be automatically replaced by a left or right double quote depending on its position in a word. Default is `True`.

### `strut_style`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#strut_style "Direct link to strut_style")

The strut style used for the vertical layout.

Value is of type [`StrutStyle`](/docs/reference/types/strutstyle).

### `suffix`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#suffix "Direct link to suffix")

Optional `Control` to place on the line after the input.

### `suffix_visibility_mode`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#suffix_visibility_mode "Direct link to suffix_visibility_mode")

Defines the visibility of the `suffix` control based on the state of text entry. Has no effect if `suffix` is not specified.

Value is of type [`VisibilityMode`](/docs/reference/types/visibilitymode) and defaults to `VisibilityMode.ALWAYS`.

### `text_align`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#text_align "Direct link to text_align")

How the text should be aligned horizontally.

Value is of type [`TextAlign`](/docs/reference/types/textalign) and defaults to `TextAlign.LEFT`.

### `text_size`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#text_size "Direct link to text_size")

Text size in virtual pixels.

### `text_vertical_align`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#text_vertical_align "Direct link to text_vertical_align")

Defines how the text should be aligned vertically.

Value can either be a number ranging from `-1.0` (topmost location) to `1.0` (bottommost location) or of type [`VerticalAlignment`](/docs/reference/types/verticalalignment). Defaults to `VerticalAlignment.CENTER`.

### `text_style`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#text_style "Direct link to text_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for the text being edited.

### `value`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#value "Direct link to value")

Current value of the TextField.

## Methods[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#methods "Direct link to Methods")

### `focus()`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#focus "Direct link to focus")

Moves focus to a TextField.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_blur`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#on_blur "Direct link to on_blur")

Fires when the control has lost focus.

### `on_change`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#on_change "Direct link to on_change")

Fires when the typed input for the TextField has changed.

### `on_click`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#on_click "Direct link to on_click")

Fires when the control is clicked.

### `on_focus`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#on_focus "Direct link to on_focus")

Fires when the control has received focus.

### `on_submit`[​](/docs/controls/cupertinotextfield#on_submit "Direct link to on_submit")

Fires when user presses ENTER while focus is on TextField.

# Dropdown

A material design button for selecting from a list of items.

A dropdown lets the user select from a number of items. The dropdown shows the currently selected item as well as an arrow that opens a menu for selecting another item.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/input/dropdown)

### Basic dropdown[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#basic-dropdown "Direct link to Basic dropdown")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    def button_clicked(e):        t.value = f"Dropdown value is:  {dd.value}"        page.update()    t = ft.Text()    b = ft.ElevatedButton(text="Submit", on_click=button_clicked)    dd = ft.Dropdown(        width=100,        options=[            ft.dropdown.Option("Red"),            ft.dropdown.Option("Green"),            ft.dropdown.Option("Blue"),        ],    )    page.add(dd, b, t)ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/dropdown/img/docs/controls/dropdown/basic-dropdown.gif)

### Dropdown with label and hint[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#dropdown-with-label-and-hint "Direct link to Dropdown with label and hint")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    page.add(        ft.Dropdown(            label="Color",            hint_text="Choose your favourite color?",            options=[                ft.dropdown.Option("Red"),                ft.dropdown.Option("Green"),                ft.dropdown.Option("Blue"),            ],            autofocus=True,        )    )ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/dropdown/img/docs/controls/dropdown/dropdown-with-custom-content.gif)

### Dropdown with `on_change` event[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#dropdown-with-on_change-event "Direct link to dropdown-with-on_change-event")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    def dropdown_changed(e):        t.value = f"Dropdown changed to {dd.value}"        page.update()    t = ft.Text()    dd = ft.Dropdown(        on_change=dropdown_changed,        options=[            ft.dropdown.Option("Red"),            ft.dropdown.Option("Green"),            ft.dropdown.Option("Blue"),        ],        width=200,    )    page.add(dd, t)ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/dropdown/img/docs/controls/dropdown/dropdown-with-change-event.gif)

### Change items in dropdown options[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#change-items-in-dropdown-options "Direct link to Change items in dropdown options")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    def find_option(option_name):        for option in d.options:            if option_name == option.key:                return option        return None    def add_clicked(e):        d.options.append(ft.dropdown.Option(option_textbox.value))        d.value = option_textbox.value        option_textbox.value = ""        page.update()    def delete_clicked(e):        option = find_option(d.value)        if option != None:            d.options.remove(option)            # d.value = None            page.update()    d = ft.Dropdown()    option_textbox = ft.TextField(hint_text="Enter item name")    add = ft.ElevatedButton("Add", on_click=add_clicked)    delete = ft.OutlinedButton("Delete selected", on_click=delete_clicked)    page.add(d, ft.Row(controls=[option_textbox, add, delete]))ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/dropdown/img/docs/controls/dropdown/dropdown-with-add-and-delete.gif)

## `Dropdown` properties[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#dropdown-properties "Direct link to dropdown-properties")

### `alignment`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#alignment "Direct link to alignment")

Defines how the `hint` or the selected item is positioned within this dropdown.

Alignment is an instance of [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment) class.

### `autofocus`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#autofocus "Direct link to autofocus")

True if the control will be selected as the initial focus. If there is more than one control on a page with autofocus set, then the first one added to the page will get focus.

### `bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#bgcolor "Direct link to bgcolor")

The background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of both the dropdown button and it's menu.

To set a different background color for the dropdown button, use `fill_color` or `focused_bgcolor` properties.

### `border`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#border "Direct link to border")

Border around input.

Value is of type [`InputBorder`](/docs/reference/types/inputborder) and defaults to `InputBorder.OUTLINE`.

### `border_color`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#border_color "Direct link to border_color")

Border [color](/docs/reference/colors). Could be `transparent` to hide the border.

### `border_radius`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#border_radius "Direct link to border_radius")

Border radius is an instance of [`BorderRadius`](/docs/reference/types/borderradius) class.

### `border_width`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#border_width "Direct link to border_width")

The width of the border in virtual pixels. Set to `0` to completely remove border.

Defaults to `1`.

### `color`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#color "Direct link to color")

Text [color](/docs/reference/colors).

### `content_padding`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#content_padding "Direct link to content_padding")

The [padding](/docs/reference/types/padding) for the input decoration's container.

### `counter`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#counter "Direct link to counter")

A `Control` to place below the line as a character count.

If `None` or an empty string and `counter_text` isn't specified, then nothing will appear in the counter's location.

### `counter_style`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#counter_style "Direct link to counter_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for `counter_text`.

### `counter_text`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#counter_text "Direct link to counter_text")

Optional text to place below the line as a character count.

If `None` or an empty string and `counter` isn't specified, then nothing will appear in the counter's location. If `counter` is specified and visible, then this `counter_text` will be ignored.

### `dense`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#dense "Direct link to dense")

Whether the TextField is part of a dense form (ie, uses less vertical space).

### `disabled_hint_content`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#disabled_hint_content "Direct link to disabled_hint_content")

A placeholder `Control` for the dropdown's value that is displayed when `value` is `None` and the dropdown is disabled.

### `elevation`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#elevation "Direct link to elevation")

The dropdown's elevation.

Defaults to `8`.

### `enable_feedback`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#enable_feedback "Direct link to enable_feedback")

Whether detected gestures should provide acoustic and/or haptic feedback. On Android, for example, setting this to `True` produce a click sound and a long-press will produce a short vibration.

Defaults to `True`.

### `error_style`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#error_style "Direct link to error_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for `error_text`.

### `error_text`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#error_text "Direct link to error_text")

Text that appears below the input border.

If non-null, the border's color animates to red and the `helper_text` is not shown.

### `filled`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#filled "Direct link to filled")

If `True` the decoration's container is filled with theme `fill_color`.

If `filled=None`(default), then it is implicitly set to `True` when at least one of the following is not `None`: `fill_color`, `focused_bgcolor` and `bgcolor`.

### `fill_color`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#fill_color "Direct link to fill_color")

Background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of the dropdown button. Will not be visible if `filled=False`.

### `focused_bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#focused_bgcolor "Direct link to focused_bgcolor")

Background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of dropdown in focused state. Will not be visible if `filled=False`.

### `focused_border_color`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#focused_border_color "Direct link to focused_border_color")

Border [color](/docs/reference/colors) in focused state.

### `focused_border_width`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#focused_border_width "Direct link to focused_border_width")

Border width in focused state.

### `focused_color`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#focused_color "Direct link to focused_color")

Text [color](/docs/reference/colors) when Dropdown is focused.

### `helper_style`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#helper_style "Direct link to helper_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for `helper_text`.

### `helper_text`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#helper_text "Direct link to helper_text")

Text that provides context about the input's value, such as how the value will be used.

If non-null, the text is displayed below the input decorator, in the same location as `error_text`. If a non-null `error_text` value is specified then the helper text is not shown.

### `hint_content`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#hint_content "Direct link to hint_content")

A placeholder `Control` for the dropdown's value that is displayed when `value` is `None`.

### `hint_style`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#hint_style "Direct link to hint_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for `hint_text`.

### `hint_text`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#hint_text "Direct link to hint_text")

Text that suggests what sort of input the field accepts.

Displayed on top of the input when it's empty and either (a) `label` is null or (b) the input has the focus.

### `icon`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#icon "Direct link to icon")

The [name of the icon](/docs/reference/icons) or `Control` to show before the input field and outside of the decoration's container.

Example with icon name:

```
icon=ft.Icons.BOOKMARK
```

Example with Control:

```
icon=ft.Icon(ft.Icons.BOOKMARK)
```

### `icon_content`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#icon_content "Direct link to icon_content")

The control to use for the drop-down button's icon. Defaults to an `Icon(icons.ARROW_DROP_DOWN)`.

**Deprecated in v0.25.0 and will be removed in v0.28.0. Use [`icon`](/docs/controls/dropdown#select_icon) instead.**

### `icon_enabled_color`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#icon_enabled_color "Direct link to icon_enabled_color")

The color of any `Icon` descendant of `icon_content` if this button is enabled.

**Deprecated in v0.25.0 and will be removed in v0.28.0. Use [`select_icon_enabled_color`](/docs/controls/dropdown#select_icon_enabled_color) instead.**

### `icon_disabled_color`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#icon_disabled_color "Direct link to icon_disabled_color")

The color of any `Icon` descendant of `icon_content` if this button is disabled.

**Deprecated in v0.25.0 and will be removed in v0.28.0. Use [`select_icon_enabled_color`](/docs/controls/dropdown#select_icon_enabled_color) instead.**

### `icon_size`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#icon_size "Direct link to icon_size")

The size of the icon button which wraps `icon_content`.

Defaults to `24.0`.

**Deprecated in v0.25.0 and will be removed in v0.28.0. Use [`icon`](/docs/controls/dropdown#icon) instead.**

### `item_height`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#item_height "Direct link to item_height")

The height of the items/options in the dropdown menu.

### `label`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#label "Direct link to label")

Optional text that describes the input field.

When the input field is empty and unfocused, the label is displayed on top of the input field (i.e., at the same location on the screen where text may be entered in the input field). When the input field receives focus (or if the field is non-empty) the label moves above, either vertically adjacent to, or to the center of the input field.

### `label_style`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#label_style "Direct link to label_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for `label`.

### `max_menu_height`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#max_menu_height "Direct link to max_menu_height")

The maximum height of the dropdown menu.

### `options`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#options "Direct link to options")

A list of `Option` controls representing items in this dropdown.

### `options_fill_horizontally`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#options_fill_horizontally "Direct link to options_fill_horizontally")

Whether the dropdown's inner contents to horizontally fill its parent. By default this button's inner width is the minimum size of its content.

If `True`, the inner width is expanded to fill its surrounding container.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

### `padding`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#padding "Direct link to padding")

The [padding](/docs/reference/types/padding) around the visible portion of this dropdown.

### `prefix`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#prefix "Direct link to prefix")

Optional `Control` to place on the line before the input.

This can be used, for example, to add some padding to text that would otherwise be specified using `prefix_text`, or to add a custom control in front of the input. The control's baseline is lined up with the input baseline.

Only one of `prefix` and `prefix_text` can be specified.

The `prefix` appears after the `prefix_icon`, if both are specified.

### `prefix_icon`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#prefix_icon "Direct link to prefix_icon")

An icon that appears before the `prefix` or `prefix_text` and before the editable part of the text field, within the decoration's container.

### `prefix_style`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#prefix_style "Direct link to prefix_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for `prefix_text`.

### `prefix_text`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#prefix_text "Direct link to prefix_text")

Optional text `prefix` to place on the line before the input.

### `select_icon`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#select_icon "Direct link to select_icon")

The [name of the icon](/docs/reference/icons) or `Control` to use for the drop-down select button's icon. Defaults to an `Icon(ft.Icons.ARROW_DROP_DOWN)`.

Example with icon name:

```
icon=ft.Icons.BOOKMARK
```

Example with Control:

```
icon=ft.Icon(ft.Icons.BOOKMARK)
```

### `select_icon_enabled_color`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#select_icon_enabled_color "Direct link to select_icon_enabled_color")

The color of any `Icon` descendant of `select_icon` if this button is enabled.

### `select_icon_disabled_color`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#select_icon_disabled_color "Direct link to select_icon_disabled_color")

The color of any `Icon` descendant of `select_icon` if this button is disabled.

### `select_icon_size`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#select_icon_size "Direct link to select_icon_size")

The size of the icon button which wraps `select_icon`.

Defaults to `24.0`.

### `suffix`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#suffix "Direct link to suffix")

Optional `Control` to place on the line after the input.

This can be used, for example, to add some padding to the text that would otherwise be specified using `suffix_text`, or to add a custom control after the input. The control's baseline is lined up with the input baseline.

Only one of `suffix` and `suffix_text` can be specified.

The `suffix` appears before the `suffix_icon`, if both are specified.

### `suffix_icon`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#suffix_icon "Direct link to suffix_icon")

An icon that appears after the editable part of the text field and after the `suffix` or `suffix_text`, within the decoration's container.

### `suffix_style`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#suffix_style "Direct link to suffix_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for `suffix_text`.

### `suffix_text`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#suffix_text "Direct link to suffix_text")

Optional text `suffix` to place on the line after the input.

### `text_size`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#text_size "Direct link to text_size")

Text size in virtual pixels.

### `text_style`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#text_style "Direct link to text_style")

The [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) to use for text in this dropdown button and the dropdown menu that appears when you tap the button.

### `value`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#value "Direct link to value")

`key` value of the selected option.

## `Dropdown` methods[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#dropdown-methods "Direct link to dropdown-methods")

### `focus()`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#focus "Direct link to focus")

Moves focus to this dropdown.

## `Dropdown` events[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#dropdown-events "Direct link to dropdown-events")

### `on_blur`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#on_blur "Direct link to on_blur")

Fires when the control has lost focus.

### `on_change`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#on_change "Direct link to on_change")

Fires when the selected item of this dropdown has changed.

### `on_click`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#on_click "Direct link to on_click")

Fires when this dropdown is clicked.

### `on_focus`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#on_focus "Direct link to on_focus")

Fires when the control has received focus.

## `Option` properties[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#option-properties "Direct link to option-properties")

Represents an item in a dropdown. Either `key` or `text` must be specified, else an `AssertionError` will be raised.

### `alignment`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#alignment-1 "Direct link to alignment-1")

Defines the alignment of this option in it's container.

Value is of type [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment) and defaults to `alignment.center_left`.

### `content`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#content "Direct link to content")

A `Control` to display in this option. If not specified, `text` will be used as fallback, else `text`will be ignored.

### `key`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#key "Direct link to key")

Option's key. If not specified `text` will be used as fallback.

### `text`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#text "Direct link to text")

Option's display text. If not specified `key` will be used as fallback.

### `text_style`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#text_style-1 "Direct link to text_style-1")

Defines the style of the `text`.

Value is of type [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle).

## `Option` Events[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#option-events "Direct link to option-events")

### `on_click`[​](/docs/controls/dropdown#on_click-1 "Direct link to on_click-1")

Fires when this option is clicked.

# Radio

Radio buttons let people select a single option from two or more choices.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/radio#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/input/radio)

### Basic RadioGroup[​](/docs/controls/radio#basic-radiogroup "Direct link to Basic RadioGroup")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page):  def button_clicked(e):    t.value = f"Your favorite color is:  {cg.value}"    page.update()  t = ft.Text()  b = ft.ElevatedButton(text='Submit', on_click=button_clicked)  cg = ft.RadioGroup(content=ft.Column([    ft.Radio(value="red", label="Red"),    ft.Radio(value="green", label="Green"),    ft.Radio(value="blue", label="Blue")]))    page.add(ft.Text("Select your favorite color:"), cg, b, t)ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/radio/img/docs/controls/radio/basic-radio.gif)

### RadioGroup with `on_change` event[​](/docs/controls/radio#radiogroup-with-on_change-event "Direct link to radiogroup-with-on_change-event")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page):  def radiogroup_changed(e):    t.value = f"Your favorite color is:  {e.control.value}"    page.update()  t = ft.Text()  cg = ft.RadioGroup(content=ft.Column([    ft.Radio(value="red", label="Red"),    ft.Radio(value="green", label="Green"),    ft.Radio(value="blue", label="Blue")]), on_change=radiogroup_changed)    page.add(ft.Text("Select your favorite color:"), cg, t)ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/radio/img/docs/controls/radio/radio-with-change-event.gif)

## `RadioGroup` properties[​](/docs/controls/radio#radiogroup-properties "Direct link to radiogroup-properties")

### `content`[​](/docs/controls/radio#content "Direct link to content")

The content of the RadioGroup. Typically a list of `Radio` controls nested in a container control, e.g. `Column`, `Row`.

### `value`[​](/docs/controls/radio#value "Direct link to value")

Current value of the RadioGroup.

## `RadioGroup` events[​](/docs/controls/radio#radiogroup-events "Direct link to radiogroup-events")

### `on_change`[​](/docs/controls/radio#on_change "Direct link to on_change")

Fires when the state of the RadioGroup is changed.

## `Radio` properties[​](/docs/controls/radio#radio-properties "Direct link to radio-properties")

### `active_color`[​](/docs/controls/radio#active_color "Direct link to active_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) used to fill this radio when it is selected.

### `adaptive`[​](/docs/controls/radio#adaptive "Direct link to adaptive")

If the value is `True`, an adaptive Radio is created based on whether the target platform is iOS/macOS.

On iOS and macOS, a [`CupertinoRadio`](/docs/controls/cupertinoradio) is created, which has matching functionality and presentation as `Radio`, and the graphics as expected on iOS. On other platforms, a Material Radio is created.

Defaults to `False`.

### `autofocus`[​](/docs/controls/radio#autofocus "Direct link to autofocus")

True if the control will be selected as the initial focus. If there is more than one control on a page with autofocus set, then the first one added to the page will get focus.

### `fill_color`[​](/docs/controls/radio#fill_color "Direct link to fill_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) that fills the radio, in all or specific [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states.

### `focus_color`[​](/docs/controls/radio#focus_color "Direct link to focus_color")

The color of this radio when it has the input focus.

### `hover_color`[​](/docs/controls/radio#hover_color "Direct link to hover_color")

The color of this radio when it is hovered.

### `label`[​](/docs/controls/radio#label "Direct link to label")

The clickable label to display on the right of a Radio.

### `label_style`[​](/docs/controls/radio#label_style "Direct link to label_style")

The label's style.

Value is of type [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle).

### `label_position`[​](/docs/controls/radio#label_position "Direct link to label_position")

Value is of type [`LabelPosition`](/docs/reference/types/labelposition) and defaults to `LabelPosition.RIGHT`.

### `mouse_cursor`[​](/docs/controls/radio#mouse_cursor "Direct link to mouse_cursor")

The cursor for a mouse pointer entering or hovering over this control.

Value is of type [`MouseCursor`](/docs/reference/types/mousecursor).

### `overlay_color`[​](/docs/controls/radio#overlay_color "Direct link to overlay_color")

The overlay [color](/docs/reference/colors) of this radio in all or specific [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states.

### `splash_radius`[​](/docs/controls/radio#splash_radius "Direct link to splash_radius")

The splash radius of the circular Material ink response.

### `toggleable`[​](/docs/controls/radio#toggleable "Direct link to toggleable")

Set to `True` if this radio button is allowed to be returned to an indeterminate state by selecting it again when selected.

### `value`[​](/docs/controls/radio#value-1 "Direct link to value-1")

The value to set to containing `RadioGroup` when the radio is selected.

### `visual_density`[​](/docs/controls/radio#visual_density "Direct link to visual_density")

Defines how compact the radio's layout will be.

Value is of type [`ThemeVisualDensity`](/docs/reference/types/themevisualdensity).

## `Radio` events[​](/docs/controls/radio#radio-events "Direct link to radio-events")

### `on_blur`[​](/docs/controls/radio#on_blur "Direct link to on_blur")

Fires when the control has lost focus.

### `on_focus`[​](/docs/controls/radio#on_focus "Direct link to on_focus")

Fires when the control has received focus.

# RangeSlider

A Material Design range slider. Used to select a range from a range of values. A range slider can be used to select from either a continuous or a discrete set of values. The default is to use a continuous range of values from min to max.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/input/rangeslider)

### Range slider with divisions and labels[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#range-slider-with-divisions-and-labels "Direct link to Range slider with divisions and labels")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    range_slider = ft.RangeSlider(        min=0,        max=50,        start_value=10,        divisions=10,        end_value=20,        inactive_color=ft.Colors.GREEN_300,        active_color=ft.Colors.GREEN_700,        overlay_color=ft.Colors.GREEN_100,        label="{value}%",    )    page.add(        ft.Column(            horizontal_alignment=ft.CrossAxisAlignment.CENTER,            controls=[                ft.Text(                    "Range slider with divisions and labels",                    size=20,                    weight=ft.FontWeight.BOLD,                ),                ft.Container(height=30),                range_slider,            ],        )    )ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/rangeslider/img/docs/controls/rangeslider/rangeslider.gif)

### RangeSlider with events[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#rangeslider-with-events "Direct link to RangeSlider with events")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    def slider_change_start(e):        print(f"on_change_start: {e.control.start_value}, {e.control.end_value}")    def slider_is_changing(e):        print(f"on_change: {e.control.start_value}, {e.control.end_value}")    def slider_change_end(e):        print(f"on_change_end: {e.control.start_value}, {e.control.end_value}")    range_slider = ft.RangeSlider(        min=0,        max=50,        start_value=10,        end_value=20,        on_change_start=slider_change_start,        on_change=slider_is_changing,        on_change_end=slider_change_end,    )    page.add(        ft.Column(            horizontal_alignment=ft.CrossAxisAlignment.CENTER,            controls=[                ft.Text(                    "Range slider with events",                    size=20,                    weight=ft.FontWeight.BOLD,                ),                ft.Container(height=30),                range_slider,            ],        )    )ft.app(main)
```

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `active_color`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#active_color "Direct link to active_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use for the portion of the slider track that is active.

The "active" segment of the range slider is the span between the thumbs.

### `divisions`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#divisions "Direct link to divisions")

The number of discrete divisions.

Typically used with `label` to show the current discrete values.

If not set, the slider is continuous.

### `end_value`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#end_value "Direct link to end_value")

The currently selected end value for the slider.

The slider's right thumb is drawn at a position that corresponds to this value.

### `inactive_color`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#inactive_color "Direct link to inactive_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) for the inactive portions of the slider track.

The "inactive" segments of the slider are the span of tracks between the min and the start thumb, and the end thumb and the max.

### `label`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#label "Direct link to label")

A label to show above the slider thumbs when the slider is active. The value of `label` may contain `{value}` which will be replaced with a current slider `start_value` and `end_value`.

If not set, then the labels will not be displayed.

### `max`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#max "Direct link to max")

The maximum value the user can select. Must be greater than or equal to `min`.

If the `max` is equal to the `min`, then the slider is disabled.

Defaults to `1.0`.

### `min`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#min "Direct link to min")

The minimum value the user can select.

Defaults to `0.0`. Must be less than or equal to `max`.

If the `max` is equal to the `min`, then the slider is disabled.

### `mouse_cursor`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#mouse_cursor "Direct link to mouse_cursor")

The cursor for a mouse pointer entering or hovering over this control. It's value can be made to depend on the slider's [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate).

Value is of type [`MouseCursor`](/docs/reference/types/mousecursor).

### `overlay_color`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#overlay_color "Direct link to overlay_color")

The highlight [color](/docs/reference/colors) that's typically used to indicate that the range slider thumb is in `HOVERED` or `DRAGGED` [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate)s.

### `round`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#round "Direct link to round")

The number of decimals displayed on the `label` containing `{value}`. The default is 0 (displays value rounded to the nearest integer).

### `start_value`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#start_value "Direct link to start_value")

The currently selected start value for the slider.

The slider's left thumb is drawn at a position that corresponds to this value.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_change`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#on_change "Direct link to on_change")

Fires when the state of the Slider is changed.

### `on_change_end`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#on_change_end "Direct link to on_change_end")

Fires when the user is done selecting a new value for the slider.

### `on_change_start`[​](/docs/controls/rangeslider#on_change_start "Direct link to on_change_start")

Fires when the user starts selecting a new value for the slider.

# SearchBar

A Material Design search bar. It visually looks like a `TextField`.

To open the search view when the search bar is tapped, call the [`open_view()`](/docs/controls/searchbar#open_view) method in the [`on_tap`](/docs/controls/searchbar#on_tap) event handler.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/input/searchbar)

### Basic Example[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#basic-example "Direct link to Basic Example")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page):    def close_anchor(e):        text = f"Color {e.control.data}"        print(f"closing view from {text}")        anchor.close_view(text)    def handle_change(e):        print(f"handle_change e.data: {e.data}")    def handle_submit(e):        print(f"handle_submit e.data: {e.data}")    def handle_tap(e):        print(f"handle_tap")        anchor.open_view()    anchor = ft.SearchBar(        view_elevation=4,        divider_color=ft.Colors.AMBER,        bar_hint_text="Search colors...",        view_hint_text="Choose a color from the suggestions...",        on_change=handle_change,        on_submit=handle_submit,        on_tap=handle_tap,        controls=[            ft.ListTile(title=ft.Text(f"Color {i}"), on_click=close_anchor, data=i)            for i in range(10)        ],    )    page.add(        ft.Row(            alignment=ft.MainAxisAlignment.CENTER,            controls=[                ft.OutlinedButton(                    "Open Search View",                    on_click=lambda _: anchor.open_view(),                ),            ],        ),        anchor,    )ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/searchbar/img/docs/controls/search-bar/searchbar-basic.gif)

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `autofocus`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#autofocus "Direct link to autofocus")

Whether the text field should focus itself if nothing else is already focused.

Defaults to `False`.

### `bar_bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#bar_bgcolor "Direct link to bar_bgcolor")

Defines the background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of the search bar in all or specific [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states.

### `bar_hint_text`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#bar_hint_text "Direct link to bar_hint_text")

Defines the text to be shown in the search bar when it is empty and the search view is close. Usually some text that suggests what sort of input the field accepts.

### `bar_leading`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#bar_leading "Direct link to bar_leading")

A `Control` to display before the text input field when the search view is close. This is typically an `Icon` or an `IconButton`.

### `bar_overlay_color`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#bar_overlay_color "Direct link to bar_overlay_color")

Defines the highlight [color](/docs/reference/colors) that's typically used to indicate that the search bar is in `FOCUSED`, `HOVERED`, or `PRESSED` [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states.

### `bar_scroll_padding`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#bar_scroll_padding "Direct link to bar_scroll_padding")

Configures the padding around a Scrollable when the text field scrolls into view.

If the bar's text field is partially off-screen or covered (e.g., by the keyboard), it scrolls into view, ensuring it is positioned at the specified distance from the Scrollable edges.

Value is of type [`Padding`](/docs/reference/types/padding).

### `bar_trailing`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#bar_trailing "Direct link to bar_trailing")

A `Control` to display after the text input field when the search view is close.

These controls can represent additional modes of searching (e.g voice search), an avatar, or an overflow menu and are usually not more than two.

### `capitalization`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#capitalization "Direct link to capitalization")

Enables automatic on-the-fly capitalization of entered text.

Value is of type [`TextCapitalization`](/docs/reference/types/textcapitalization).

### `controls`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#controls "Direct link to controls")

The list of controls to be displayed below the search bar when in search view. These controls are usually `ListTile`s and will be displayed in a `ListView`.

### `divider_color`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#divider_color "Direct link to divider_color")

The color of the divider when in search view.

### `full_screen`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#full_screen "Direct link to full_screen")

Defines whether the search view grows to fill the entire screen when the search bar is tapped. Defaults to `False`.

### `header_hint_style`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#header_hint_style "Direct link to header_hint_style")

Defines the [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) of `view_hint_text`.

### `header_text_style`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#header_text_style "Direct link to header_text_style")

Defines the [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) of the text being edited on the search view.

### `keyboard_type`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#keyboard_type "Direct link to keyboard_type")

The type of action button to use for the keyboard.

Value is of type [`KeyboardType`](/docs/reference/types/keyboardtype) and defaults to `KeyboardType TEXT`.

### `value`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#value "Direct link to value")

The text in the search bar.

### `view_bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#view_bgcolor "Direct link to view_bgcolor")

Defines the background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of the search view.

### `view_elevation`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#view_elevation "Direct link to view_elevation")

Defines the elevation of the search view.

### `view_hint_text`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#view_hint_text "Direct link to view_hint_text")

Defines the text to be displayed when the search bar's input field is empty.

### `view_leading`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#view_leading "Direct link to view_leading")

A `Control` to display before the text input field when the search view is open. Typically an `Icon` or an `IconButton`.

Defaults to a back button which closes/pops the search view.

### `view_shape`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#view_shape "Direct link to view_shape")

Defines the shape of the search view.

Value is of type [`OutlinedBorder`](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder).

### `view_side`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#view_side "Direct link to view_side")

Defines the color and weight of the search view's outline.

Value is of type [`BorderSide`](/docs/reference/types/borderside).

### `view_surface_tint_color`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#view_surface_tint_color "Direct link to view_surface_tint_color")

Defines the color of the search view's surface tint.

### `view_trailing`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#view_trailing "Direct link to view_trailing")

A list of `Control`s to display after the text input field when the search view is open.

Defaults to a close button which closes/pops the search view.

## Methods[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#methods "Direct link to Methods")

### `close_view(text)`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#close_viewtext "Direct link to close_viewtext")

Closes the search view. The `text` parameter (defaults to an empty string) is the text to be shown in the search bar after the search view is closed.

### `open_view()`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#open_view "Direct link to open_view")

Opens the search view.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_change`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#on_change "Direct link to on_change")

Fires when the typed input in the search bar has changed.

### `on_submit`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#on_submit "Direct link to on_submit")

Fires when user presses ENTER while focus is on SearchBar.

### `on_tap`[​](/docs/controls/searchbar#on_tap "Direct link to on_tap")

Fires when the search bar is tapped.

# Slider

A slider provides a visual indication of adjustable content, as well as the current setting in the total range of content.

Use a slider when you want people to set defined values (such as volume or brightness), or when people would benefit from instant feedback on the effect of setting changes.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/slider#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/input/slider)

### Basic sliders[​](/docs/controls/slider#basic-sliders "Direct link to Basic sliders")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page):    page.add(        ft.Text("Default slider:"),        ft.Slider(),        ft.Text("Default disabled slider:"),        ft.Slider(disabled=True))ft.app(main)
```

### Sliders with values[​](/docs/controls/slider#sliders-with-values "Direct link to Sliders with values")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page):    page.add(        ft.Text("Slider with value:"),        ft.Slider(value=0.3),        ft.Text("Slider with a custom range and label:"),        ft.Slider(min=0, max=100, divisions=10, label="{value}%"))ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/slider/img/docs/controls/slider/slider-with-custom-content.gif)

### Slider with `on_change` event[​](/docs/controls/slider#slider-with-on_change-event "Direct link to slider-with-on_change-event")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page):    def slider_changed(e):        t.value = f"Slider changed to {e.control.value}"        page.update()    t = ft.Text()    page.add(        ft.Text("Slider with 'on_change' event:"),        ft.Slider(min=0, max=100, divisions=10, label="{value}%", on_change=slider_changed), t)ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/slider/img/docs/controls/slider/slider-with-change-event.gif)

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/slider#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `active_color`[​](/docs/controls/slider#active_color "Direct link to active_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use for the portion of the slider track that is active.

The "active" side of the slider is the side between the thumb and the minimum value.

### `adaptive`[​](/docs/controls/slider#adaptive "Direct link to adaptive")

If the value is `True`, an adaptive Slider is created based on whether the target platform is iOS or macOS.

On iOS and macOS, a [`CupertinoSlider`](/docs/controls/cupertinoslider), which has matching functionality and presentation as `Slider`, and are the graphics expected on iOS. On other platforms, this creates a Material Slider.

Defaults to `False`.

### `autofocus`[​](/docs/controls/slider#autofocus "Direct link to autofocus")

True if the control will be selected as the initial focus. If there is more than one control on a page with autofocus set, then the first one added to the page will get focus.

### `divisions`[​](/docs/controls/slider#divisions "Direct link to divisions")

The number of discrete divisions.

Typically used with `label` to show the current discrete value.

If not set, the slider is continuous.

### `inactive_color`[​](/docs/controls/slider#inactive_color "Direct link to inactive_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) for the inactive portion of the slider track.

The "inactive" side of the slider is the side between the thumb and the maximum value.

### `interaction`[​](/docs/controls/slider#interaction "Direct link to interaction")

The allowed way for the user to interact with this slider. Value is a [`SliderInteraction`](/docs/reference/types/sliderinteraction) and defaults to `SliderInteraction.TAP_AND_SLIDE`.

### `label`[​](/docs/controls/slider#label "Direct link to label")

Format with `{value}`.

A label to show above the slider when the slider is active. The value of `label` may contain `{value}` which will be replaced with a current slider value.

It is used to display the value of a discrete slider, and it is displayed as part of the value indicator shape.

If not set, then the value indicator will not be displayed.

### `max`[​](/docs/controls/slider#max "Direct link to max")

The maximum value the user can select. Must be greater than or equal to `min`.

If the `max` is equal to the `min`, then the slider is disabled.

Defaults to `1.0`.

### `min`[​](/docs/controls/slider#min "Direct link to min")

The minimum value the user can select. Must be less than or equal to `max`.

If the `max` is equal to the `min`, then the slider is disabled.

Defaults to `0.0`.

### `mouse_cursor`[​](/docs/controls/slider#mouse_cursor "Direct link to mouse_cursor")

The cursor to be displayed when a mouse pointer enters or is hovering over this control.

Value is of type [`MouseCursor`](/docs/reference/types/mousecursor).

### `overlay_color`[​](/docs/controls/slider#overlay_color "Direct link to overlay_color")

The highlight [color](/docs/reference/colors) that's typically used to indicate that the range slider thumb is in `ControlState.HOVERED` or `DRAGGED` [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate)s.

### `round`[​](/docs/controls/slider#round "Direct link to round")

The number of decimals displayed on the `label` containing `value`.

Defaults to `0`, which displays value rounded to the nearest integer.

### `secondary_active_color`[​](/docs/controls/slider#secondary_active_color "Direct link to secondary_active_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use for the portion of the slider track between the thumb and the `secondary_track_value`.

### `secondary_track_value`[​](/docs/controls/slider#secondary_track_value "Direct link to secondary_track_value")

The secondary track value for this slider.

If not null, a secondary track using `secondary_active_color` is drawn between the thumb and this value, over the inactive track. If less than `value`, then the secondary track is not shown.

It can be ideal for media scenarios such as showing the buffering progress while the `value` shows the play progress.

### `thumb_color`[​](/docs/controls/slider#thumb_color "Direct link to thumb_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) of the thumb.

### `value`[​](/docs/controls/slider#value "Direct link to value")

The currently selected value for this slider.

The slider's thumb is drawn at a position that corresponds to this value.

Defaults to value of `min` property.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/slider#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_blur`[​](/docs/controls/slider#on_blur "Direct link to on_blur")

Fires when the control has lost focus.

### `on_change`[​](/docs/controls/slider#on_change "Direct link to on_change")

Fires when the state of the Slider is changed.

### `on_change_end`[​](/docs/controls/slider#on_change_end "Direct link to on_change_end")

Fires when the user is done selecting a new value for the slider.

### `on_change_start`[​](/docs/controls/slider#on_change_start "Direct link to on_change_start")

Fires when the user starts selecting a new value for the slider.

### `on_focus`[​](/docs/controls/slider#on_focus "Direct link to on_focus")

Fires when the control has received focus.

# Switch

A toggle represents a physical switch that allows someone to choose between two mutually exclusive options.

For example, "On/Off", "Show/Hide". Choosing an option should produce an immediate result.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/switch#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/input/switch)

### Basic switches[​](/docs/controls/switch#basic-switches "Direct link to Basic switches")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page):    def button_clicked(e):        t.value = (            f"Switch values are:  {c1.value}, {c2.value}, {c3.value}, {c4.value}."        )        page.update()    t = ft.Text()    c1 = ft.Switch(label="Unchecked switch", value=False)    c2 = ft.Switch(label="Checked switch", value=True)    c3 = ft.Switch(label="Disabled switch", disabled=True)    c4 = ft.Switch(        label="Switch with rendered label_position='left'", label_position=ft.LabelPosition.LEFT    )    b = ft.ElevatedButton(text="Submit", on_click=button_clicked)    page.add(c1, c2, c3, c4, b, t)ft.app(main, view=ft.AppView.WEB_BROWSER)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/switch/img/docs/controls/switch/basic-switch.gif)

### Switch with `on_change` event[​](/docs/controls/switch#switch-with-on_change-event "Direct link to switch-with-on_change-event")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    def theme_changed(e):        page.theme_mode = (            ft.ThemeMode.DARK            if page.theme_mode == ft.ThemeMode.LIGHT            else ft.ThemeMode.LIGHT        )        c.label = (            "Light theme" if page.theme_mode == ft.ThemeMode.LIGHT else "Dark theme"        )        page.update()    page.theme_mode = ft.ThemeMode.LIGHT    c = ft.Switch(label="Light theme", on_change=theme_changed)    page.add(c)ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/switch/img/docs/controls/switch/switch-with-change-event.gif)

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/switch#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `active_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#active_color "Direct link to active_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use when this switch is on.

### `active_track_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#active_track_color "Direct link to active_track_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use on the track when this switch is on.

If `track_color` returns a non-null color in the `SELECTED` state, it will be used instead of this color.

### `adaptive`[​](/docs/controls/switch#adaptive "Direct link to adaptive")

If the value is `True`, an adaptive Switch is created based on whether the target platform is iOS/macOS.

On iOS and macOS, a `CupertinoSwitch` is created, which has matching functionality and presentation as `Switch`, and the graphics as expected on iOS. On other platforms, a Material Switch is created.

Defaults to `False`. See the example of usage [here](/docs/controls/cupertinoswitch#cupertinoswitch-and-adaptive-switch).

### `autofocus`[​](/docs/controls/switch#autofocus "Direct link to autofocus")

True if the control will be selected as the initial focus. If there is more than one control on a page with autofocus set, then the first one added to the page will get focus.

### `focus_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#focus_color "Direct link to focus_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use for the focus highlight for keyboard interactions.

### `hover_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#hover_color "Direct link to hover_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to be used when it is being hovered over by the mouse pointer.

### `inactive_thumb_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#inactive_thumb_color "Direct link to inactive_thumb_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use on the thumb when this switch is off.

Defaults to colors defined in the [material design specification](https://m3.material.io/components/switch/specs).

If `thumb_color` returns a non-null color in the `DEFAULT` state, it will be used instead of this color.

### `inactive_thumb_image`[​](/docs/controls/switch#inactive_thumb_image "Direct link to inactive_thumb_image")

An image to use on the thumb of this switch when the switch is off. Can be a local file path or URL.

### `inactive_track_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#inactive_track_color "Direct link to inactive_track_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use on the track when this switch is off.

Defaults to colors defined in the [material design specification](https://m3.material.io/components/switch/specs).

If `track_color` returns a non-null color in the `DEFAULT` state, it will be used instead of this color.

### `label`[​](/docs/controls/switch#label "Direct link to label")

The clickable label to display on the right of the Switch.

### `label_style`[​](/docs/controls/switch#label_style "Direct link to label_style")

The label's style.

Value is of type [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle).

### `label_position`[​](/docs/controls/switch#label_position "Direct link to label_position")

Value is of type [`LabelPosition`](/docs/reference/types/labelposition) and defaults to `LabelPosition.RIGHT`.

### `mouse_cursor`[​](/docs/controls/switch#mouse_cursor "Direct link to mouse_cursor")

The cursor to be displayed when a mouse pointer enters or is hovering over this control. The value is [`MouseCursor`](/docs/reference/types/mousecursor) enum.

### `overlay_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#overlay_color "Direct link to overlay_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) for the switch's Material in various [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states. The following [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) values are supported: `PRESSED`, `SELECTED`, `HOVERED`, `FOCUSED` and `DEFAULT`.

### `splash_radius`[​](/docs/controls/switch#splash_radius "Direct link to splash_radius")

The radius of the splash effect when the switch is pressed.

### `thumb_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#thumb_color "Direct link to thumb_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) of this switch's thumb in various [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states. The following [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) values are supported: `SELECTED`, `HOVERED`, `DISABLED`, `FOCUSED` and `DEFAULT` (fallback).

### `thumb_icon`[​](/docs/controls/switch#thumb_icon "Direct link to thumb_icon")

The icon of this Switch's thumb in various [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states. The following [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) values are supported: `SELECTED`, `HOVERED`, `DISABLED`, `FOCUSED` and `DEFAULT` (fallback).

### `track_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#track_color "Direct link to track_color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) of this switch's track in various [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states. The following [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) values are supported: `SELECTED`, `HOVERED`, `DISABLED`, `FOCUSED` and `DEFAULT` (fallback).

### `track_outline_color`[​](/docs/controls/switch#track_outline_color "Direct link to track_outline_color")

The outline [color](/docs/reference/colors) of this switch's track in various [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states. The following [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) values are supported: `SELECTED`, `HOVERED`, `DISABLED`, `FOCUSED` and `DEFAULT` (fallback).

### `track_outline_width`[​](/docs/controls/switch#track_outline_width "Direct link to track_outline_width")

The outline width of this switch's track in all or specific [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) states. The following states are supported: `SELECTED`, `HOVERED`, `DISABLED`, `FOCUSED` and `DEFAULT` (fallback).

### `value`[​](/docs/controls/switch#value "Direct link to value")

Current value of the Switch.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/switch#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_blur`[​](/docs/controls/switch#on_blur "Direct link to on_blur")

Fires when the control has lost focus.

### `on_change`[​](/docs/controls/switch#on_change "Direct link to on_change")

Fires when the state of the Switch is changed.

### `on_focus`[​](/docs/controls/switch#on_focus "Direct link to on_focus")

Fires when the control has received focus.

Event handler argument is of type [`OnFocusEvent`](/docs/reference/types/onfocusevent).
