# SnackBar

A lightweight message with an optional action which briefly displays at the bottom of the screen.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/dialogs/snackbar)

### SnackBar with dynamic message[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#snackbar-with-dynamic-message "Direct link to SnackBar with dynamic message")

python/controls/snack-bar/simple-snack.py

```
loading...
```

[View on GitHub](https://github.com/flet-dev/examples/blob/main/python/controls/snack-bar/simple-snack.py)

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/snackbar/img/docs/controls/snackbar/snackbar-with-custom-content.gif)

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `action`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#action "Direct link to action")

An optional action that the user can take based on the snack bar.

For example, the snack bar might let the user undo the operation that prompted the snackbar. Snack bars can have at most one action.

The action should not be "dismiss" or "cancel".

### `action_color`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#action_color "Direct link to action_color")

The foreground [color](/docs/reference/colors) of action button.

### `action_overflow_threshold`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#action_overflow_threshold "Direct link to action_overflow_threshold")

The percentage (between `0.0` and `1.0`) threshold for `action`'s width before it overflows to a new line.

If the width of the snackbar's `content` is greater than this percentage of the width of the snackbar minus the width of its `action`, then the `action` will appear below the `content`.

At a value of `0.0`, the `action` will not overflow to a new line.

Defaults to `0.25`.

### `behavior`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#behavior "Direct link to behavior")

This defines the behavior and location of the snack bar.

Defines where a SnackBar should appear within a page and how its location should be adjusted when the page also includes a `FloatingActionButton` or a `NavigationBar`.

Value is of type [`SnackBarBehavior`](/docs/reference/types/snackbarbehavior) and defaults to `SnackBarBehavior.FIXED`.

**Note:**

-   If `behavior=SnackBarBehavior.FLOATING`, the length of the bar is defined by either `width` or `margin`, and if both are specified, `width` takes precedence over `margin`.
-   `width` and `margin` are ignored if `behavior!=SnackBarBehavior.FLOATING`.

### `bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#bgcolor "Direct link to bgcolor")

SnackBar background [color](/docs/reference/colors).

### `clip_behavior`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#clip_behavior "Direct link to clip_behavior")

The `content` will be clipped (or not) according to this option.

Value is of type [`ClipBehavior`](/docs/reference/types/clipbehavior) and defaults to `ClipBehavior.HARD_EDGE`.

### `close_icon_color`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#close_icon_color "Direct link to close_icon_color")

An optional color for the close icon, if `show_close_icon=True`.

### `content`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#content "Direct link to content")

The primary content of the snack bar.

Typically a [`Text`](/docs/controls/text) control.

### `dismiss_direction`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#dismiss_direction "Direct link to dismiss_direction")

The direction in which the SnackBar can be dismissed.

Value is of type [`DismissDirection`](/docs/reference/types/dismissdirection) and defaults to `DismissDirection.DOWN`.

### `duration`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#duration "Direct link to duration")

The number of *milliseconds* that the SnackBar stays open for.

Defaults to `4000` ([4 seconds](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/material/SnackBar/duration.html)).

### `elevation`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#elevation "Direct link to elevation")

The z-coordinate at which to place the snack bar. This controls the size of the shadow below the snack bar.

### `margin`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#margin "Direct link to margin")

Empty space to surround the snack bar.

Has effect only when `behavior=SnackBarBehavior.FLOATING` and will be ignored if `width` is specified.

### `open`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#open "Direct link to open")

Set to `True` to display a SnackBar. This property is automatically set to `False` once SnackBar is shown.

### `padding`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#padding "Direct link to padding")

The amount of padding to apply to the snack bar's content and optional action.

Value is of type [`Padding`](/docs/reference/types/padding) or a number.

### `shape`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#shape "Direct link to shape")

The shape of the snack bar's.

Value is of type [`OutlinedBorder`](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder).

### `show_close_icon`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#show_close_icon "Direct link to show_close_icon")

Whether to include a "close" icon widget.

Tapping the icon will close the snack bar.

### `width`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#width "Direct link to width")

The width of the snack bar.

If width is specified, the snack bar will be centered horizontally in the available space.

Has effect only when `behavior=SnackBarBehavior.FLOATING`. It can not be used if `margin` is specified.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_action`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#on_action "Direct link to on_action")

Fires when action button is clicked.

### `on_visible`[​](/docs/controls/snackbar#on_visible "Direct link to on_visible")

Fires the first time that the snackbar is visible within the page.

# TimePicker

A Material-style time picker dialog.

To open this control, simply call the [`page.open()`](/docs/controls/page#opencontrol) helper-method.

Depending on the [`time_picker_entry_mode`](/docs/controls/timepicker#time_picker_entry_mode), it will show either a Dial or an Input (hour and minute text fields) for picking a time.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/dialogs/timepicker)

### Basic time picker[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#basic-time-picker "Direct link to Basic time picker")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    page.horizontal_alignment = ft.CrossAxisAlignment.CENTER    def handle_change(e):        page.add(ft.Text(f"TimePicker change: {time_picker.value}"))    def handle_dismissal(e):        page.add(ft.Text(f"TimePicker dismissed: {time_picker.value}"))    def handle_entry_mode_change(e):        page.add(ft.Text(f"TimePicker Entry mode changed to {e.entry_mode}"))    time_picker = ft.TimePicker(        confirm_text="Confirm",        error_invalid_text="Time out of range",        help_text="Pick your time slot",        on_change=handle_change,        on_dismiss=handle_dismissal,        on_entry_mode_change=handle_entry_mode_change,    )    page.add(        ft.ElevatedButton(            "Pick time",            icon=ft.Icons.TIME_TO_LEAVE,            on_click=lambda _: page.open(time_picker),        )    )ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/timepicker/img/docs/controls/timepicker/time-picker.png)

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `cancel_text`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#cancel_text "Direct link to cancel_text")

The text that is displayed on the cancel button. The default value is "Cancel".

### `confirm_text`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#confirm_text "Direct link to confirm_text")

The text that is displayed on the confirm button. The default value is "OK".

### `error_invalid_text`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#error_invalid_text "Direct link to error_invalid_text")

The error message displayed below the input text field if the input is not a valid hour/minute. The default value is "Enter a valid time".

### `hour_label_text`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#hour_label_text "Direct link to hour_label_text")

The text that is displayed below the hour input text field.

The default value is "Hour".

### `help_text`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#help_text "Direct link to help_text")

The text that is displayed at the top of the header.

This is used to indicate to the user what they are selecting a time for. The default value is "Enter time".

### `minute_label_text`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#minute_label_text "Direct link to minute_label_text")

The text that is displayed below the minute input text field.

The default value is "Minute".

### `orientation`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#orientation "Direct link to orientation")

The orientation of the dialog when displayed. Value is of type `Orientation` enum which has the following possible values: `PORTRAIT` and `LANDSCAPE`.

### `time_picker_entry_mode`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#time_picker_entry_mode "Direct link to time_picker_entry_mode")

The initial mode of time entry method for the time picker dialog.

Value is of type [`TimePickerEntryMode`](/docs/reference/types/timepickerentrymode) and defaults to `TimePickerEntryMode.DIAL`.

### `value`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#value "Direct link to value")

The selected time that the picker should display. The default value is equal to the current time.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_change`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#on_change "Direct link to on_change")

Fires when user clicks confirm button. `value` property is updated with selected time. `e.data` also contains the selected time.

### `on_dismiss`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#on_dismiss "Direct link to on_dismiss")

Fires when dialog is dismissed by clicking on the cancel button or outside of time picker dialog.

### `on_entry_mode_change`[​](/docs/controls/timepicker#on_entry_mode_change "Direct link to on_entry_mode_change")

Fires when the `time_picker_entry_mode` is changed.

Event handler argument is of type [`TimePickerEntryModeChangeEvent`](/docs/reference/types/timepickerentrymodechangeevent).

# BarChart

Draws a bar chart.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/barchart#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/charts/barchart)

### BarChart 1[​](/docs/controls/barchart#barchart-1 "Direct link to BarChart 1")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/barchart/img/docs/controls/charts/barchart-sample-1.png)

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    chart = ft.BarChart(        bar_groups=[            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=0,                bar_rods=[                    ft.BarChartRod(                        from_y=0,                        to_y=40,                        width=40,                        color=ft.Colors.AMBER,                        tooltip="Apple",                        border_radius=0,                    ),                ],            ),            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=1,                bar_rods=[                    ft.BarChartRod(                        from_y=0,                        to_y=100,                        width=40,                        color=ft.Colors.BLUE,                        tooltip="Blueberry",                        border_radius=0,                    ),                ],            ),            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=2,                bar_rods=[                    ft.BarChartRod(                        from_y=0,                        to_y=30,                        width=40,                        color=ft.Colors.RED,                        tooltip="Cherry",                        border_radius=0,                    ),                ],            ),            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=3,                bar_rods=[                    ft.BarChartRod(                        from_y=0,                        to_y=60,                        width=40,                        color=ft.Colors.ORANGE,                        tooltip="Orange",                        border_radius=0,                    ),                ],            ),        ],        border=ft.border.all(1, ft.Colors.GREY_400),        left_axis=ft.ChartAxis(            labels_size=40, title=ft.Text("Fruit supply"), title_size=40        ),        bottom_axis=ft.ChartAxis(            labels=[                ft.ChartAxisLabel(                    value=0, label=ft.Container(ft.Text("Apple"), padding=10)                ),                ft.ChartAxisLabel(                    value=1, label=ft.Container(ft.Text("Blueberry"), padding=10)                ),                ft.ChartAxisLabel(                    value=2, label=ft.Container(ft.Text("Cherry"), padding=10)                ),                ft.ChartAxisLabel(                    value=3, label=ft.Container(ft.Text("Orange"), padding=10)                ),            ],            labels_size=40,        ),        horizontal_grid_lines=ft.ChartGridLines(            color=ft.Colors.GREY_300, width=1, dash_pattern=[3, 3]        ),        tooltip_bgcolor=ft.Colors.with_opacity(0.5, ft.Colors.GREY_300),        max_y=110,        interactive=True,        expand=True,    )    page.add(chart)ft.app(main)
```

### BarChart 2[​](/docs/controls/barchart#barchart-2 "Direct link to BarChart 2")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/barchart/img/docs/controls/charts/barchart-sample-2.gif)

```
import flet as ftclass SampleRod(ft.BarChartRod):    def __init__(self, y: float, hovered: bool = False):        super().__init__()        self.hovered = hovered        self.y = y    def _before_build_command(self):        self.to_y = self.y + 1 if self.hovered else self.y        self.color = ft.Colors.YELLOW if self.hovered else ft.Colors.WHITE        self.border_side = (            ft.BorderSide(width=1, color=ft.Colors.GREEN_400)            if self.hovered            else ft.BorderSide(width=0, color=ft.Colors.WHITE)        )        super()._before_build_command()    def _build(self):        self.tooltip = str(self.y)        self.width = 22        self.color = ft.Colors.WHITE        self.bg_to_y = 20        self.bg_color = ft.Colors.GREEN_300def main(page: ft.Page):    def on_chart_event(e: ft.BarChartEvent):        for group_index, group in enumerate(chart.bar_groups):            for rod_index, rod in enumerate(group.bar_rods):                rod.hovered = e.group_index == group_index and e.rod_index == rod_index        chart.update()    chart = ft.BarChart(        bar_groups=[            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=0,                bar_rods=[SampleRod(5)],            ),            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=1,                bar_rods=[SampleRod(6.5)],            ),            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=2,                bar_rods=[SampleRod(5)],            ),            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=3,                bar_rods=[SampleRod(7.5)],            ),            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=4,                bar_rods=[SampleRod(9)],            ),            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=5,                bar_rods=[SampleRod(11.5)],            ),            ft.BarChartGroup(                x=6,                bar_rods=[SampleRod(6)],            ),        ],        bottom_axis=ft.ChartAxis(            labels=[                ft.ChartAxisLabel(value=0, label=ft.Text("M")),                ft.ChartAxisLabel(value=1, label=ft.Text("T")),                ft.ChartAxisLabel(value=2, label=ft.Text("W")),                ft.ChartAxisLabel(value=3, label=ft.Text("T")),                ft.ChartAxisLabel(value=4, label=ft.Text("F")),                ft.ChartAxisLabel(value=5, label=ft.Text("S")),                ft.ChartAxisLabel(value=6, label=ft.Text("S")),            ],        ),        on_chart_event=on_chart_event,        interactive=True,    )    page.add(        ft.Container(            chart, bgcolor=ft.Colors.GREEN_200, padding=10, border_radius=5, expand=True        )    )ft.app(main)
```

## `BarChart` properties[​](/docs/controls/barchart#barchart-properties "Direct link to barchart-properties")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/barchart/img/docs/controls/charts/barchart-diagram.svg)

### `animate`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#animate "Direct link to animate")

Controls chart implicit animation.

Value is of [`AnimationValue`](/docs/reference/types/animationvalue) type.

### `bar_groups`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#bar_groups "Direct link to bar_groups")

The list of [`BarChartGroup`](/docs/reference/types/barchartgroup) to draw.

### `baseline_y`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#baseline_y "Direct link to baseline_y")

Baseline value for Y axis.

Defaults to `0`.

### `bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#bgcolor "Direct link to bgcolor")

Background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of the chart.

### `border`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#border "Direct link to border")

The border around the chart.

Value is of type [`Border`](/docs/reference/types/border).

### `bottom_axis`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#bottom_axis "Direct link to bottom_axis")

Configures the appearance of the bottom axis, its title and labels. The value is the instance of [`ChartAxis`](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis) class.

### `groups_space`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#groups_space "Direct link to groups_space")

A gap between bar groups.

### `horizontal_grid_lines`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#horizontal_grid_lines "Direct link to horizontal_grid_lines")

Controls drawing of chart's horizontal lines.

Value is of type [`ChartGridLines`](/docs/reference/types/chartgridlines).

### `interactive`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#interactive "Direct link to interactive")

Enables automatic tooltips when hovering chart bars.

### `left_axis`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#left_axis "Direct link to left_axis")

Configures the appearance of the left axis, its title and labels.

Value is of type [`ChartAxis`](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis).

### `max_y`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#max_y "Direct link to max_y")

Configures the maximum displayed value for Y axis.

### `min_y`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#min_y "Direct link to min_y")

Configures the minimum displayed value for Y axis.

### `right_axis`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#right_axis "Direct link to right_axis")

Configures the appearance of the right axis, its title and labels. The value is the instance of [`ChartAxis`](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis) class.

### `top_axis`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#top_axis "Direct link to top_axis")

Configures the appearance of the top axis, its title and labels. The value is the instance of [`ChartAxis`](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis) class.

### `tooltip_bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_bgcolor "Direct link to tooltip_bgcolor")

Background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of tooltips.

### `tooltip_border_side`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_border_side "Direct link to tooltip_border_side")

The tooltip border side.

### `tooltip_direction`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_direction "Direct link to tooltip_direction")

Controls showing tooltip on top or bottom, default is auto.

### `tooltip_fit_inside_horizontally`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_fit_inside_horizontally "Direct link to tooltip_fit_inside_horizontally")

Forces the tooltip to shift horizontally inside the chart, if overflow happens.

Value is of type `bool`.

### `tooltip_fit_inside_vertically`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_fit_inside_vertically "Direct link to tooltip_fit_inside_vertically")

Forces the tooltip to shift vertically inside the chart, if overflow happens.

Value is of type `bool`.

### `tooltip_horizontal_offset`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_horizontal_offset "Direct link to tooltip_horizontal_offset")

Applies horizontal offset for showing tooltip.

Defaults to `0`.

### `tooltip_margin`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_margin "Direct link to tooltip_margin")

Applies a bottom margin for showing tooltip on top of rods.

### `tooltip_max_content_width`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_max_content_width "Direct link to tooltip_max_content_width")

Restricts the tooltip's width.

### `tooltip_padding`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_padding "Direct link to tooltip_padding")

Applies a padding for showing contents inside the tooltip.

### `tooltip_rounded_radius`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_rounded_radius "Direct link to tooltip_rounded_radius")

Sets a rounded radius for the tooltip.

### `tooltip_rotate_angle`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#tooltip_rotate_angle "Direct link to tooltip_rotate_angle")

The rotation angle of the tooltip.

### `vertical_grid_lines`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#vertical_grid_lines "Direct link to vertical_grid_lines")

Controls drawing of chart's vertical lines.

Value is of type [`ChartGridLines`](/docs/reference/types/chartgridlines).

## `BarChart` events[​](/docs/controls/barchart#barchart-events "Direct link to barchart-events")

### `on_chart_event`[​](/docs/controls/barchart#on_chart_event "Direct link to on_chart_event")

Fires when a bar is hovered or clicked.

Event handler receives an instance of [`BarChartEvent`](/docs/reference/types/barchartevent).

# LineChart

Draws a line chart.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/linechart#examples "Direct link to Examples")

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/linechart#properties "Direct link to Properties")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/linechart/img/docs/controls/charts/linechart-diagram.svg)

### `animate`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#animate "Direct link to animate")

Controls chart implicit animation.

Value is of type [`AnimationValue`](/docs/reference/types/animationvalue).

### `baseline_x`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#baseline_x "Direct link to baseline_x")

Baseline value for X axis.

Defaults to `0`.

### `baseline_y`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#baseline_y "Direct link to baseline_y")

Baseline value for Y axis.

Defaults to `0`.

### `bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#bgcolor "Direct link to bgcolor")

Background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of the chart.

### `border`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#border "Direct link to border")

The border around the chart.

Value is of type [`Border`](/docs/reference/types/border).

### `bottom_axis`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#bottom_axis "Direct link to bottom_axis")

Defines the appearance of the bottom axis, its title and labels.

Value is of type [`ChartAxis`](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis).

### `data_series`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#data_series "Direct link to data_series")

A list of [`LineChartData`](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata) controls drawn as separate lines on a chart.

### `horizontal_grid_lines`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#horizontal_grid_lines "Direct link to horizontal_grid_lines")

Controls drawing of chart's horizontal lines.

Value is of type [`ChartGridLines`](/docs/reference/types/chartgridlines).

### `interactive`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#interactive "Direct link to interactive")

Enables automatic tooltips and points highlighting when hovering over the chart.

### `left_axis`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#left_axis "Direct link to left_axis")

Defines the appearance of the left axis, its title and labels.

Value is of type [`ChartAxis`](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis) class.

### `max_x`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#max_x "Direct link to max_x")

Defines the maximum displayed value for X axis.

### `max_y`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#max_y "Direct link to max_y")

Defines the maximum displayed value for Y axis.

### `min_x`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#min_x "Direct link to min_x")

Defines the minimum displayed value for X axis.

### `min_y`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#min_y "Direct link to min_y")

Defines the minimum displayed value for Y axis.

### `point_line_end`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#point_line_end "Direct link to point_line_end")

The end of the vertical line drawn at selected point position.

Defaults to data point's `y` value.

### `point_line_start`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#point_line_start "Direct link to point_line_start")

The start of the vertical line drawn under the selected point.

Defaults to chart's bottom edge.

### `right_axis`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#right_axis "Direct link to right_axis")

Defines the appearance of the right axis, its title and labels.

Value is of type [`ChartAxis`](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis) class.

### `tooltip_bgcolor`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_bgcolor "Direct link to tooltip_bgcolor")

Background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of tooltips.

### `tooltip_border_side`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_border_side "Direct link to tooltip_border_side")

The tooltip border side.

### `tooltip_direction`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_direction "Direct link to tooltip_direction")

Controls showing tooltip on top or bottom.

Value is of type [`TooltipDirection`](/docs/reference/types/charttooltipdirection) and defaults to `TooltipDirection.AUTO`.

### `tooltip_fit_inside_horizontally`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_fit_inside_horizontally "Direct link to tooltip_fit_inside_horizontally")

Forces the tooltip to shift horizontally inside the chart, if overflow happens.

Value is of type `bool`.

### `tooltip_fit_inside_vertically`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_fit_inside_vertically "Direct link to tooltip_fit_inside_vertically")

Forces the tooltip to shift vertically inside the chart, if overflow happens.

Value is of type `bool`.

### `tooltip_horizontal_offset`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_horizontal_offset "Direct link to tooltip_horizontal_offset")

Applies horizontal offset for showing tooltip.

### `tooltip_margin`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_margin "Direct link to tooltip_margin")

Applies a bottom margin for showing tooltip on top of rods.

### `tooltip_max_content_width`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_max_content_width "Direct link to tooltip_max_content_width")

Restricts the tooltip's width.

### `tooltip_padding`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_padding "Direct link to tooltip_padding")

Applies a padding for showing contents inside the tooltip.

Value is of type [`PaddingValue`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#paddingvalue).

### `tooltip_rounded_radius`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_rounded_radius "Direct link to tooltip_rounded_radius")

Sets a rounded radius for the tooltip.

### `tooltip_rotate_angle`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_rotate_angle "Direct link to tooltip_rotate_angle")

The rotation angle of the tooltip.

### `tooltip_show_on_top_of_chart_box_area`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#tooltip_show_on_top_of_chart_box_area "Direct link to tooltip_show_on_top_of_chart_box_area")

Whether to force the tooltip container to the top of the line.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

### `top_axis`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#top_axis "Direct link to top_axis")

Defines the appearance of the top axis, its title and labels.

Value is of type [`ChartAxis`](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis).

### `vertical_grid_lines`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#vertical_grid_lines "Direct link to vertical_grid_lines")

Controls drawing of chart's vertical lines.

Value is of type [`ChartGridLines`](/docs/reference/types/chartgridlines).

## Events[​](/docs/controls/linechart#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_chart_event`[​](/docs/controls/linechart#on_chart_event "Direct link to on_chart_event")

Fires when a chart line is hovered or clicked.

Value is of type [`LineChartEvent`](/docs/reference/types/linechartevent).

# MatplotlibChart

Displays [Matplotlib](https://matplotlib.org/) chart.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/matplotlibchart#examples "Direct link to Examples")

### Bar color chart[​](/docs/controls/matplotlibchart#bar-color-chart "Direct link to Bar color chart")

The following example is based on [original example from Matplotlib docs](https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/lines_bars_and_markers/bar_colors.html#sphx-glr-gallery-lines-bars-and-markers-bar-colors-py).

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/matplotlibchart/img/docs/controls/charts/matplotlib-barchart.png)

```
import matplotlibimport matplotlib.pyplot as pltimport flet as ftfrom flet.matplotlib_chart import MatplotlibChartmatplotlib.use("svg")def main(page: ft.Page):    fig, ax = plt.subplots()    fruits = ["apple", "blueberry", "cherry", "orange"]    counts = [40, 100, 30, 55]    bar_labels = ["red", "blue", "_red", "orange"]    bar_colors = ["tab:red", "tab:blue", "tab:red", "tab:orange"]    ax.bar(fruits, counts, label=bar_labels, color=bar_colors)    ax.set_ylabel("fruit supply")    ax.set_title("Fruit supply by kind and color")    ax.legend(title="Fruit color")    page.add(MatplotlibChart(fig, expand=True))ft.app(main)
```

### Line chart[​](/docs/controls/matplotlibchart#line-chart "Direct link to Line chart")

The following example is based on [original example from Matplotlib docs](https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/lines_bars_and_markers/cohere.html#sphx-glr-gallery-lines-bars-and-markers-cohere-py).

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/matplotlibchart/img/docs/controls/charts/matplotlib-linechart.png)

```
import matplotlibimport matplotlib.pyplot as pltimport numpy as npimport flet as ftfrom flet.matplotlib_chart import MatplotlibChartmatplotlib.use("svg")def main(page: ft.Page):    # Fixing random state for reproducibility    np.random.seed(19680801)    dt = 0.01    t = np.arange(0, 30, dt)    nse1 = np.random.randn(len(t))  # white noise 1    nse2 = np.random.randn(len(t))  # white noise 2    # Two signals with a coherent part at 10Hz and a random part    s1 = np.sin(2 * np.pi * 10 * t) + nse1    s2 = np.sin(2 * np.pi * 10 * t) + nse2    fig, axs = plt.subplots(2, 1)    axs[0].plot(t, s1, t, s2)    axs[0].set_xlim(0, 2)    axs[0].set_xlabel("time")    axs[0].set_ylabel("s1 and s2")    axs[0].grid(True)    cxy, f = axs[1].cohere(s1, s2, 256, 1.0 / dt)    axs[1].set_ylabel("coherence")    fig.tight_layout()    page.add(MatplotlibChart(fig, expand=True))ft.app(main)
```

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/matplotlibchart#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `figure`[​](/docs/controls/matplotlibchart#figure "Direct link to figure")

Matplotlib figure to draw - an instance of `matplotlib.figure.Figure` class.

### `isolated`[​](/docs/controls/matplotlibchart#isolated "Direct link to isolated")

Every time when a page or parent chart control are updated with `page.update()` or `Control.update()` methods respectively the chart is re-drawn by calling Matplotlib API. Frequent re-drawings of large charts could affect the performance of the entire Flet app.

Set `isolated` to `True` to enable explicit chart updates. To re-draw the chart call its `update()` method. For example the first example on this page could be modified as following:

```
def main(page: ft.Page):    # ...    # set initial axis legent    ax.legend(title="Fruit color")    # enable explicit updates    # and add chart to a page    chart1 = MatplotlibChart(fig, isolated=True, expand=True)    page.add(chart1)    sleep(5)    # update chart axis    ax.legend(title="Colors")    chart1.update()ft.app(main)
```

### `original_size`[​](/docs/controls/matplotlibchart#original_size "Direct link to original_size")

Whether to display chart in original size.

Defaults to `False` - display a chart that fits configured bounds.

### `transparent`[​](/docs/controls/matplotlibchart#transparent "Direct link to transparent")

Whether to remove the background from the chart.

Defaults to `False` - display a chart with background.

# PieChart

Draws a pie chart.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/piechart#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/charts/piechart)

### PieChart 1[​](/docs/controls/piechart#piechart-1 "Direct link to PieChart 1")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/piechart/img/docs/controls/charts/piechart-sample-1.gif)

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    normal_border = ft.BorderSide(0, ft.Colors.with_opacity(0, ft.Colors.WHITE))    hovered_border = ft.BorderSide(6, ft.Colors.WHITE)    def on_chart_event(e: ft.PieChartEvent):        for idx, section in enumerate(chart.sections):            section.border_side = (                hovered_border if idx == e.section_index else normal_border            )        chart.update()    chart = ft.PieChart(        sections=[            ft.PieChartSection(                25,                color=ft.Colors.BLUE,                radius=80,                border_side=normal_border,            ),            ft.PieChartSection(                25,                color=ft.Colors.YELLOW,                radius=65,                border_side=normal_border,            ),            ft.PieChartSection(                25,                color=ft.Colors.PINK,                radius=60,                border_side=normal_border,            ),            ft.PieChartSection(                25,                color=ft.Colors.GREEN,                radius=70,                border_side=normal_border,            ),        ],        sections_space=1,        center_space_radius=0,        on_chart_event=on_chart_event,        expand=True,    )    page.add(chart)ft.app(main)
```

### PieChart 2[​](/docs/controls/piechart#piechart-2 "Direct link to PieChart 2")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/piechart/img/docs/controls/charts/piechart-sample-2.gif)

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    normal_radius = 50    hover_radius = 60    normal_title_style = ft.TextStyle(        size=16, color=ft.Colors.WHITE, weight=ft.FontWeight.BOLD    )    hover_title_style = ft.TextStyle(        size=22,        color=ft.Colors.WHITE,        weight=ft.FontWeight.BOLD,        shadow=ft.BoxShadow(blur_radius=2, color=ft.Colors.BLACK54),    )    def on_chart_event(e: ft.PieChartEvent):        for idx, section in enumerate(chart.sections):            if idx == e.section_index:                section.radius = hover_radius                section.title_style = hover_title_style            else:                section.radius = normal_radius                section.title_style = normal_title_style        chart.update()    chart = ft.PieChart(        sections=[            ft.PieChartSection(                40,                title="40%",                title_style=normal_title_style,                color=ft.Colors.BLUE,                radius=normal_radius,            ),            ft.PieChartSection(                30,                title="30%",                title_style=normal_title_style,                color=ft.Colors.YELLOW,                radius=normal_radius,            ),            ft.PieChartSection(                15,                title="15%",                title_style=normal_title_style,                color=ft.Colors.PURPLE,                radius=normal_radius,            ),            ft.PieChartSection(                15,                title="15%",                title_style=normal_title_style,                color=ft.Colors.GREEN,                radius=normal_radius,            ),        ],        sections_space=0,        center_space_radius=40,        on_chart_event=on_chart_event,        expand=True,    )    page.add(chart)ft.app(main)
```

### PieChart 3[​](/docs/controls/piechart#piechart-3 "Direct link to PieChart 3")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/piechart/img/docs/controls/charts/piechart-sample-3.gif)

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    normal_radius = 100    hover_radius = 110    normal_title_style = ft.TextStyle(        size=12, color=ft.Colors.WHITE, weight=ft.FontWeight.BOLD    )    hover_title_style = ft.TextStyle(        size=16,        color=ft.Colors.WHITE,        weight=ft.FontWeight.BOLD,        shadow=ft.BoxShadow(blur_radius=2, color=ft.Colors.BLACK54),    )    normal_badge_size = 40    hover_badge_size = 50    def badge(icon, size):        return ft.Container(            ft.Icon(icon),            width=size,            height=size,            border=ft.border.all(1, ft.Colors.BROWN),            border_radius=size / 2,            bgcolor=ft.Colors.WHITE,        )    def on_chart_event(e: ft.PieChartEvent):        for idx, section in enumerate(chart.sections):            if idx == e.section_index:                section.radius = hover_radius                section.title_style = hover_title_style            else:                section.radius = normal_radius                section.title_style = normal_title_style        chart.update()    chart = ft.PieChart(        sections=[            ft.PieChartSection(                40,                title="40%",                title_style=normal_title_style,                color=ft.Colors.BLUE,                radius=normal_radius,                badge=badge(ft.Icons.AC_UNIT, normal_badge_size),                badge_position=0.98,            ),            ft.PieChartSection(                30,                title="30%",                title_style=normal_title_style,                color=ft.Colors.YELLOW,                radius=normal_radius,                badge=badge(ft.Icons.ACCESS_ALARM, normal_badge_size),                badge_position=0.98,            ),            ft.PieChartSection(                15,                title="15%",                title_style=normal_title_style,                color=ft.Colors.PURPLE,                radius=normal_radius,                badge=badge(ft.Icons.APPLE, normal_badge_size),                badge_position=0.98,            ),            ft.PieChartSection(                15,                title="15%",                title_style=normal_title_style,                color=ft.Colors.GREEN,                radius=normal_radius,                badge=badge(ft.Icons.PEDAL_BIKE, normal_badge_size),                badge_position=0.98,            ),        ],        sections_space=0,        center_space_radius=0,        on_chart_event=on_chart_event,        expand=True,    )    page.add(chart)ft.app(main)
```

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/piechart#properties "Direct link to Properties")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/piechart/img/docs/controls/charts/piechart-diagram.svg)

### `animate`[​](/docs/controls/piechart#animate "Direct link to animate")

Controls chart implicit animation.

Value is of type [`AnimationValue`](/docs/reference/types/animationvalue).

### `center_space_color`[​](/docs/controls/piechart#center_space_color "Direct link to center_space_color")

Free space [color](/docs/reference/colors) in the middle of a chart.

### `center_space_radius`[​](/docs/controls/piechart#center_space_radius "Direct link to center_space_radius")

Free space radius in the middle of a chart.

### `sections_space`[​](/docs/controls/piechart#sections_space "Direct link to sections_space")

A gap between `sections`.

### `start_degree_offset`[​](/docs/controls/piechart#start_degree_offset "Direct link to start_degree_offset")

By default, `sections` are drawn from zero degree (right side of the circle) clockwise. You can change the starting point, by setting `start_degree_offset` (in degrees).

### `sections`[​](/docs/controls/piechart#sections "Direct link to sections")

A list of [`PieChartSection`](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection) controls drawn in a circle.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/piechart#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_chart_event`[​](/docs/controls/piechart#on_chart_event "Direct link to on_chart_event")

Fires when a chart section is hovered or clicked.

Event data is an instance [`PieChartEvent`](/docs/reference/types/piechartevent).

# PlotlyChart

Displays [Plotly](https://plotly.com/python/) chart.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/plotlychart#examples "Direct link to Examples")

### Line chart[​](/docs/controls/plotlychart#line-chart "Direct link to Line chart")

The following example is based on [original example from Plotly docs](https://plotly.com/python/line-charts/).

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/plotlychart/img/docs/controls/charts/plotly-linechart.png)

```
import plotly.express as pximport flet as ftfrom flet.plotly_chart import PlotlyChartdef main(page: ft.Page):    df = px.data.gapminder().query("continent=='Oceania'")    fig = px.line(df, x="year", y="lifeExp", color="country")    page.add(PlotlyChart(fig, expand=True))ft.app(main)
```

### Bar chart[​](/docs/controls/plotlychart#bar-chart "Direct link to Bar chart")

The following example is based on [original example from Plotly docs](https://plotly.com/python/bar-charts/).

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/plotlychart/img/docs/controls/charts/plotly-barchart.png)

```
import plotly.express as pximport flet as ftfrom flet.plotly_chart import PlotlyChartdef main(page: ft.Page):    df = px.data.gapminder().query("continent == 'Oceania'")    fig = px.bar(        df,        x="year",        y="pop",        hover_data=["lifeExp", "gdpPercap"],        color="country",        labels={"pop": "population of Canada"},        height=400,    )    page.add(PlotlyChart(fig, expand=True))ft.app(main)
```

### Pie chart[​](/docs/controls/plotlychart#pie-chart "Direct link to Pie chart")

The following example is based on [original example from Plotly docs](https://plotly.com/python/pie-charts/).

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/plotlychart/img/docs/controls/charts/plotly-piechart.png)

```
import plotly.graph_objects as goimport flet as ftfrom flet.plotly_chart import PlotlyChartdef main(page: ft.Page):    labels = ["Oxygen", "Hydrogen", "Carbon_Dioxide", "Nitrogen"]    values = [4500, 2500, 1053, 500]    fig = go.Figure(data=[go.Pie(labels=labels, values=values)])    page.add(PlotlyChart(fig, expand=True))ft.app(main)
```

### Box chart[​](/docs/controls/plotlychart#box-chart "Direct link to Box chart")

The following example is based on [original example from Plotly docs](https://plotly.com/python/box-plots/).

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/plotlychart/img/docs/controls/charts/plotly-boxchart.png)

```
import plotly.graph_objects as goimport flet as ftfrom flet.plotly_chart import PlotlyChartdef main(page: ft.Page):    x = ['day 1', 'day 1', 'day 1', 'day 1', 'day 1', 'day 1',        'day 2', 'day 2', 'day 2', 'day 2', 'day 2', 'day 2']    fig = go.Figure()    fig.add_trace(go.Box(        y=[0.2, 0.2, 0.6, 1.0, 0.5, 0.4, 0.2, 0.7, 0.9, 0.1, 0.5, 0.3],        x=x,        name='kale',        marker_color='#3D9970'    ))    fig.add_trace(go.Box(        y=[0.6, 0.7, 0.3, 0.6, 0.0, 0.5, 0.7, 0.9, 0.5, 0.8, 0.7, 0.2],        x=x,        name='radishes',        marker_color='#FF4136'    ))    fig.add_trace(go.Box(        y=[0.1, 0.3, 0.1, 0.9, 0.6, 0.6, 0.9, 1.0, 0.3, 0.6, 0.8, 0.5],        x=x,        name='carrots',        marker_color='#FF851B'    ))    fig.update_layout(        yaxis_title='normalized moisture',        boxmode='group' # group together boxes of the different traces for each value of x    )    page.add(PlotlyChart(fig, expand=True))ft.app(main)
```

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/plotlychart#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `figure`[​](/docs/controls/plotlychart#figure "Direct link to figure")

Plotly figure to draw - an instance of `plotly.graph_objects.Figure` class.

### `original_size`[​](/docs/controls/plotlychart#original_size "Direct link to original_size")

`True` to display chart in original size. `False` (default) to display a chart that fits configured bounds.

### `isolated`[​](/docs/controls/plotlychart#isolated "Direct link to isolated")

Every time when a page or parent chart control are updated with `page.update()` or `Control.update()` methods respectively the chart is re-drawn by calling Plotly API. Frequent re-drawings of large charts could affect the performance of the entire Flet app.

Set `isolated` to `True` to enable explicit chart updates. To re-draw the chart call its `update()` method.

[Edit this page](https://github.com/flet-dev/website/edit/main/docs/controls/plotlychart.md)

On this page

# AnimatedSwitcher

A control that by default does a cross-fade between a new control and the control previously set on the AnimatedSwitcher as a `content`.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/animatedswitcher#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/animations/animated_switcher)

### Animated switching between two containers with scale effect[​](/docs/controls/animatedswitcher#animated-switching-between-two-containers-with-scale-effect "Direct link to Animated switching between two containers with scale effect")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/animatedswitcher/img/docs/controls/animated-switcher/animated-switcher.gif)

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    c1 = ft.Container(        ft.Text("Hello!", style=ft.TextThemeStyle.HEADLINE_MEDIUM),        alignment=ft.alignment.center,        width=200,        height=200,        bgcolor=ft.Colors.GREEN,    )    c2 = ft.Container(        ft.Text("Bye!", size=50),        alignment=ft.alignment.center,        width=200,        height=200,        bgcolor=ft.Colors.YELLOW,    )    c = ft.AnimatedSwitcher(        c1,        transition=ft.AnimatedSwitcherTransition.SCALE,        duration=500,        reverse_duration=100,        switch_in_curve=ft.AnimationCurve.BOUNCE_OUT,        switch_out_curve=ft.AnimationCurve.BOUNCE_IN,    )    def animate(e):        c.content = c2 if c.content == c1 else c1        c.update()    page.add(        c,        ft.ElevatedButton("Animate!", on_click=animate),    )ft.app(main)
```

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/animatedswitcher#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `content`[​](/docs/controls/animatedswitcher#content "Direct link to content")

The content to display. When the `content` changes, the AnimatedSwitcher will animate the transition from the old `content` to the new one.

Value is of type `Control`.

### `duration`[​](/docs/controls/animatedswitcher#duration "Direct link to duration")

The duration, in milliseconds, of the transition from the old `content` value to the new one.

Value is of type `int` defaults to `1000` milliseconds.

### `reverse_duration`[​](/docs/controls/animatedswitcher#reverse_duration "Direct link to reverse_duration")

The duration, in milliseconds, of the transition from the new `content` value to the old one.

Value is of type `int` and defaults to `1000` milliseconds.

### `switch_in_curve`[​](/docs/controls/animatedswitcher#switch_in_curve "Direct link to switch_in_curve")

The animation curve to use when transitioning in a new `content`.

Value is of type [`AnimationCurve`](/docs/reference/types/animationcurve) and defaults to [`AnimationCurve.LINEAR`](/docs/reference/types/animationcurve).

### `switch_out_curve`[​](/docs/controls/animatedswitcher#switch_out_curve "Direct link to switch_out_curve")

The animation curve to use when transitioning a previous `content` out.

Value is of type [`AnimationCurve`](/docs/reference/types/animationcurve) and defaults to [`AnimationCurve.LINEAR`](/docs/reference/types/animationcurve).

### `transition`[​](/docs/controls/animatedswitcher#transition "Direct link to transition")

An animation type to transition between new and old `content`.

Value is of type [`AnimatedSwitcherTransition`](/docs/reference/types/animatedswitchertransition) and defaults to [`AnimatedSwitcherTransition.FADE`](/docs/reference/types/animatedswitchertransition).

On this page

# Lottie

Displays an animation from a Lottie file (URL or local file).

Packaging

To build your Flet app that uses `Lottie` control add `--include-packages flet_lottie` to `flet build` command, for example:

```
flet build apk --include-packages flet_lottie
```

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/lottie#examples "Direct link to Examples")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    page.add(        ft.Lottie(            src='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xvrh/lottie-flutter/master/example/assets/Mobilo/A.json',            reverse=False,            animate=True        )    )ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/lottie/img/docs/controls/lottie/lottie-animation.gif)

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/lottie#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `animate`[​](/docs/controls/lottie#animate "Direct link to animate")

Whether the animation should be played automatically.

Defaults to `True`.

### `background_loading`[​](/docs/controls/lottie#background_loading "Direct link to background_loading")

Whether the animation should be loaded in the background.

### `filter_quality`[​](/docs/controls/lottie#filter_quality "Direct link to filter_quality")

The quality of the image layer.

Value is of type [`FilterQuality`](/docs/reference/types/filterquality) and defaults to `FilterQuality.LOW`.

### `fit`[​](/docs/controls/lottie#fit "Direct link to fit")

How to inscribe the Lottie composition into the space allocated during layout.

Value is of type [`ImageFit`](/docs/reference/types/imagefit).

### `repeat`[​](/docs/controls/lottie#repeat "Direct link to repeat")

Whether the animation should repeat in a loop. Has no effect if `animate` is `False`.

Defaults to `True`.

### `reverse`[​](/docs/controls/lottie#reverse "Direct link to reverse")

Whether the animation should be played in reverse (from start to end and then continuously from end to start). Has no effect if `animate` and `repeat` are `False`.

Defaults to `False`.

### `src`[​](/docs/controls/lottie#src "Direct link to src")

The source of the Lottie file. Can be a URL or a local [asset file](/docs/cookbook/assets).

### `src_base64`[​](/docs/controls/lottie#src_base64 "Direct link to src_base64")

The base64 encoded string of the Lottie file. Either this or `src` must be provided. If both are provided, `src_base64` will be prioritized/used.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/lottie#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_error`[​](/docs/controls/lottie#on_error "Direct link to on_error")

Fires when an error occurs while loading the Lottie file.

# Rive

Displays an animation from a [Rive](https://rive.app/) file (URL or local file).

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/rive#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/utility/rive)

### Basic Example[​](/docs/controls/rive#basic-example "Direct link to Basic Example")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page):    page.add(        ft.Rive(            "https://cdn.rive.app/animations/vehicles.riv",            placeholder=ft.ProgressBar(),            width=300,            height=200,        )    )ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/rive/img/docs/controls/rive/basic-rive.gif)

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/rive#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `alignment`[​](/docs/controls/rive#alignment "Direct link to alignment")

The alignment for the animation.

### `artboard`[​](/docs/controls/rive#artboard "Direct link to artboard")

The name of the artboard to use. If not specified, the default artboard of the provided `src` is used.

### `enable_antialiasing`[​](/docs/controls/rive#enable_antialiasing "Direct link to enable_antialiasing")

Whether to enable antialiasing when rendering.

Defaults to `True`.

### `fit`[​](/docs/controls/rive#fit "Direct link to fit")

The animation's fit.

### `placeholder_content`[​](/docs/controls/rive#placeholder_content "Direct link to placeholder_content")

The control to be displayed while the rive is loading.

### `src`[​](/docs/controls/rive#src "Direct link to src")

The source of your rive animation. Can either be a URL or a local asset file.

### `use_artboard_size`[​](/docs/controls/rive#use_artboard_size "Direct link to use_artboard_size")

Whether to use the inherent size of the artboard, i.e. the absolute size defined by the artboard, or size the widget based on the available constraints only (sized by parent). Defaults to `False`.

# Audio

A control to simultaneously play multiple audio files. Works on macOS, Linux, Windows, iOS, Android and web. Based on [audioplayers](https://pub.dev/packages/audioplayers) Flutter widget.

Audio control is non-visual and should be added to `page.overlay` list.

Packaging

To build your Flet app that uses `Audio` control add `--include-packages flet_audio` to `flet build` command, for example:

```
flet build apk --include-packages flet_audio
```

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/audio#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/utility/audio)

### Autoplay audio[​](/docs/controls/audio#autoplay-audio "Direct link to Autoplay audio")

-   Python

note

Autoplay works in desktop, mobile apps and Safari browser, but doesn't work in Chrome/Edge.

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    audio1 = ft.Audio(        src="https://luan.xyz/files/audio/ambient_c_motion.mp3", autoplay=True    )    page.overlay.append(audio1)    page.add(        ft.Text("This is an app with background audio."),        ft.ElevatedButton("Stop playing", on_click=lambda _: audio1.pause()),    )ft.app(main)
```

### Audio with playback controls[​](/docs/controls/audio#audio-with-playback-controls "Direct link to Audio with playback controls")

-   Python

```
import flet as fturl = "https://github.com/mdn/webaudio-examples/blob/main/audio-analyser/viper.mp3?raw=true"def main(page: ft.Page):    def volume_down(_):        audio1.volume -= 0.1        audio1.update()    def volume_up(_):        audio1.volume += 0.1        audio1.update()    def balance_left(_):        audio1.balance -= 0.1        audio1.update()    def balance_right(_):        audio1.balance += 0.1        audio1.update()    audio1 = ft.Audio(        src=url,        autoplay=False,        volume=1,        balance=0,        on_loaded=lambda _: print("Loaded"),        on_duration_changed=lambda e: print("Duration changed:", e.data),        on_position_changed=lambda e: print("Position changed:", e.data),        on_state_changed=lambda e: print("State changed:", e.data),        on_seek_complete=lambda _: print("Seek complete"),    )    page.overlay.append(audio1)    page.add(        ft.ElevatedButton("Play", on_click=lambda _: audio1.play()),        ft.ElevatedButton("Pause", on_click=lambda _: audio1.pause()),        ft.ElevatedButton("Resume", on_click=lambda _: audio1.resume()),        ft.ElevatedButton("Release", on_click=lambda _: audio1.release()),        ft.ElevatedButton("Seek 2s", on_click=lambda _: audio1.seek(2000)),        ft.Row(            [                ft.ElevatedButton("Volume down", on_click=volume_down),                ft.ElevatedButton("Volume up", on_click=volume_up),            ]        ),        ft.Row(            [                ft.ElevatedButton("Balance left", on_click=balance_left),                ft.ElevatedButton("Balance right", on_click=balance_right),            ]        ),        ft.ElevatedButton(            "Get duration", on_click=lambda _: print("Duration:", audio1.get_duration())        ),        ft.ElevatedButton(            "Get current position",            on_click=lambda _: print("Current position:", audio1.get_current_position()),        ),    )ft.app(main)
```

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/audio#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `autoplay`[​](/docs/controls/audio#autoplay "Direct link to autoplay")

Starts playing audio as soon as audio control is added to a page.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

note

Autoplay works in desktop, mobile apps and Safari browser, but doesn't work in Chrome/Edge.

### `balance`[​](/docs/controls/audio#balance "Direct link to balance")

Sets the stereo balance.

\-1 - The left channel is at full volume; the right channel is silent. 1 - The right channel is at full volume; the left channel is silent. 0 - Both channels are at the same volume.

Value is of type [`OptionalNumber`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#optionalnumber).

note

Setting balance is supported on Windows and Linux only.

### `playback_rate`[​](/docs/controls/audio#playback_rate "Direct link to playback_rate")

Sets the playback rate. iOS and macOS have limits between 0.5 and 2x Android SDK version should be 23 or higher.

Value is of type [`OptionalNumber`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#optionalnumber).

### `release_mode`[​](/docs/controls/audio#release_mode "Direct link to release_mode")

Sets the release mode.

Value is of type [`ReleaseMode`](/docs/reference/types/releasemode) and defaults to `ReleaseMode.RELEASE`.

### `src`[​](/docs/controls/audio#src "Direct link to src")

The audio source. Can be a URL or a local [asset file](/docs/cookbook/assets).

note

[Here](https://github.com/bluefireteam/audioplayers/blob/main/troubleshooting.md#supported-formats--encodings) is a list of supported audio formats.

### `src_base64`[​](/docs/controls/audio#src_base64 "Direct link to src_base64")

Sets the contents of audio file encoded in base-64 format.

Value is of type `str`.

### `volume`[​](/docs/controls/audio#volume "Direct link to volume")

Sets the volume (amplitude).

0 is mute and 1 is the max volume. The values between 0 and 1 are linearly interpolated.

Value is of type [`OptionalNumber`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#optionalnumber).

## Methods[​](/docs/controls/audio#methods "Direct link to Methods")

### `get_current_position()`[​](/docs/controls/audio#get_current_position "Direct link to get_current_position")

Returns the current position in milliseconds.

### `get_duration()`[​](/docs/controls/audio#get_duration "Direct link to get_duration")

Returns the duration of audio in milliseconds.

### `pause()`[​](/docs/controls/audio#pause "Direct link to pause")

Stops playing audio.

### `play()`[​](/docs/controls/audio#play "Direct link to play")

Starts playing audio for the beginning.

### `release()`[​](/docs/controls/audio#release "Direct link to release")

Stops playing and releases the resources associated with this audio control. The resources are going to be fetched or buffered again as soon as you call `resume()` or change the source.

### `resume()`[​](/docs/controls/audio#resume "Direct link to resume")

Resumes playing audio from the current position.

### `seek()`[​](/docs/controls/audio#seek "Direct link to seek")

Moves the cursor to the desired position.

Method arguments:

-   `position_milliseconds` - desired position in milliseconds.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/audio#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_duration_changed`[​](/docs/controls/audio#on_duration_changed "Direct link to on_duration_changed")

Fires as soon as audio duration is available (it might take a while to download or buffer it).

Event handler argument is of type [`AudioDurationChangeEvent`](/docs/reference/types/audiodurationchangeevent).

### `on_loaded`[​](/docs/controls/audio#on_loaded "Direct link to on_loaded")

Fires when an audio is loaded/buffered.

### `on_position_changed`[​](/docs/controls/audio#on_position_changed "Direct link to on_position_changed")

Fires when audio position is changed. Will continuously update the position of the playback every 1 second if the status is playing. Can be used for a progress bar.

Event handler argument is of type [`AudioPositionChangeEvent`](/docs/reference/types/audiopositionchangeevent).

### `on_seek_complete`[​](/docs/controls/audio#on_seek_complete "Direct link to on_seek_complete")

Fires on seek completions. An event is going to be sent as soon as the audio seek is finished.

### `on_state_changed`[​](/docs/controls/audio#on_state_changed "Direct link to on_state_changed")

Fires when audio player state changes.

Event handler argument is of type [`AudioStateChangeEvent`](/docs/reference/types/audiostatechangeevent).

# AudioRecorder

Audio recorder from microphone to a given file path. Works on macOS, Linux, Windows, iOS, Android and web. Based on the [record](https://pub.dev/packages/record) Dart/Flutter package.

note

On Linux, encoding is provided by [fmedia](https://stsaz.github.io/fmedia/) which must be installed separately.

AudioRecorder control is non-visual and should be added to `page.overlay` list.

Packaging

To build your Flet app that uses `AudioRecorder` control add `--include-packages flet_audio_recorder` to `flet build` command, for example:

```
flet build apk --include-packages flet_audio_recorder
```

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#examples "Direct link to Examples")

### Basic Example[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#basic-example "Direct link to Basic Example")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftasync def main(page: ft.Page):    page.horizontal_alignment = ft.CrossAxisAlignment.CENTER    page.appbar = ft.AppBar(title=ft.Text("Audio Recorder"), center_title=True)    path = "test-audio-file.wav"    async def handle_start_recording(e):        print(f"StartRecording: {path}")        await audio_rec.start_recording_async(path)    async def handle_stop_recording(e):        output_path = await audio_rec.stop_recording_async()        print(f"StopRecording: {output_path}")        if page.web and output_path is not None:            await page.launch_url_async(output_path)    async def handle_list_devices(e):        devices = await audio_rec.get_input_devices_async()        print(devices)    async def handle_has_permission(e):        try:            print(f"HasPermission: {await audio_rec.has_permission_async()}")        except Exception as e:            print(e)    async def handle_pause(e):        print(f"isRecording: {await audio_rec.is_recording_async()}")        if await audio_rec.is_recording_async():            await audio_rec.pause_recording_async()    async def handle_resume(e):        print(f"isPaused: {await audio_rec.is_paused_async()}")        if await audio_rec.is_paused_async():            await audio_rec.resume_recording_async()    async def handle_audio_encoding_test(e):        for i in list(ft.AudioEncoder):            print(f"{i}: {await audio_rec.is_supported_encoder_async(i)}")    async def handle_state_change(e):        print(f"State Changed: {e.data}")    audio_rec = ft.AudioRecorder(        audio_encoder=ft.AudioEncoder.WAV,        on_state_changed=handle_state_change,    )    page.overlay.append(audio_rec)    await page.update_async()    await page.add_async(        ft.ElevatedButton("Start Audio Recorder", on_click=handle_start_recording),        ft.ElevatedButton("Stop Audio Recorder", on_click=handle_stop_recording),        ft.ElevatedButton("List Devices", on_click=handle_list_devices),        ft.ElevatedButton("Pause Recording", on_click=handle_pause),        ft.ElevatedButton("Resume Recording", on_click=handle_resume),        ft.ElevatedButton("Test AudioEncodings", on_click=handle_audio_encoding_test),        ft.ElevatedButton("Has Permission", on_click=handle_has_permission),    )ft.app(main)
```

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#properties "Direct link to Properties")

note

Not all properties are supported on all platforms. Please check this [platform-feature parity matrix](https://pub.dev/packages/record#platform-feature-parity-matrix) for more information on which properties are supported on which platforms.

### `audio_encoder`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#audio_encoder "Direct link to audio_encoder")

The audio encoder to be used for recording.

Value is of type [`AudioEncoder`](/docs/reference/types/audioencoder) and defaults to [`AudioEncoder.WAV`](/docs/reference/types/audioencoder#wav).

See [`this`](https://pub.dev/packages/record#file) for a detailed overview on the encodings supported by each platform.

### `auto_gain`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#auto_gain "Direct link to auto_gain")

The recorder will try to auto adjust recording volume in a limited range.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

### `bit_rate`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#bit_rate "Direct link to bit_rate")

The audio encoding bit rate in bits per second.

Value is of type [`OptionalNumber`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#optionalnumber) and defaults to `128000`.

### `cancel_echo`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#cancel_echo "Direct link to cancel_echo")

The recorder will try to reduce echo.

Value is of type `bool` defaults to `False`.

### `channels_num`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#channels_num "Direct link to channels_num")

The numbers of channels for the recording. `1` = mono, `2` = stereo.

Defaults to `2`.

### `sample_rate`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#sample_rate "Direct link to sample_rate")

The sample rate for audio in samples per second.

Value is of type [`OptionalNumber`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#optionalnumber) and defaults to `44100`.

### `suppress_noise`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#suppress_noise "Direct link to suppress_noise")

The recorder will try to negates the input noise.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

## Methods[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#methods "Direct link to Methods")

### `cancel_recording()`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#cancel_recording "Direct link to cancel_recording")

Stops and discards/deletes the file/blob.

### `get_input_devices()`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#get_input_devices "Direct link to get_input_devices")

Returns a dictionary whose values are the input devices available on the platform.

### `has_permission()`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#has_permission "Direct link to has_permission")

Checks (and optionally requests) for audio record permission.

### `is_paused()`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#is_paused "Direct link to is_paused")

Checks if recording session is paused.

### `is_recording()`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#is_recording "Direct link to is_recording")

Checks if there's a valid recording session. Note that if the recording session is paused, this method will still return `True`.

### `is_supported_encoder(encoder)`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#is_supported_encoderencoder "Direct link to is_supported_encoderencoder")

Checks if the given `encoder` is supported on the current platform.

### `pause()`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#pause "Direct link to pause")

Pauses recording session.

### `resume()`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#resume "Direct link to resume")

Resumes recording session after pause.

### `seek(position_milliseconds)`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#seekposition_milliseconds "Direct link to seekposition_milliseconds")

Moves the cursor to the desired position.

### `start_recording(output_path)`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#start_recordingoutput_path "Direct link to start_recordingoutput_path")

Starts new recording session on the specified `output_path`. On platforms other than web, the `output_path` must be provided.

### `stop_recording()`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#stop_recording "Direct link to stop_recording")

Stops recording session and release internal recorder resource. It returns a string which is the location of the recorded file. On web, it returns the blob which could be opened using [`page.lauch_url()`](/docs/controls/page#launch_urlurl). On other platforms, it returns the path to the file which is the `output_path` parameter passed to `start_recording()` method.

## Events[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#events "Direct link to Events")

### `on_state_changed`[​](/docs/controls/audiorecorder#on_state_changed "Direct link to on_state_changed")

Fires when audio recorder's state changes.

Event handler argument is of type [`AudioRecorderStateChangeEvent`](/docs/reference/types/audiorecorderstatechangeevent).

# Draggable

A control that can be dragged from to a [DragTarget](/docs/controls/dragtarget).

When a draggable control recognizes the start of a drag gesture, it displays a [`content_feedback`](/docs/controls/draggable#content_feedback) control that tracks the user's finger across the screen. If the user lifts their finger while on top of a [DragTarget](/docs/controls/dragtarget), that target is given the opportunity to complete drag-and-drop flow.

This control displays [`content`](/docs/controls/draggable#content) when zero drags are under way. If [`content_when_dragging`](/docs/controls/draggable#content_when_dragging) is not `None`, this control instead displays `content_when_dragging` when one or more drags are underway. Otherwise, this widget always displays `content`.

## Examples[​](/docs/controls/draggable#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/utility/draggable)

### Drag and drop colors[​](/docs/controls/draggable#drag-and-drop-colors "Direct link to Drag and drop colors")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/controls/draggable/img/docs/controls/drag-and-drop/drag-and-drop-colors.gif)

-   Python

```
import fletfrom flet import (    Column,    Container,    Draggable,    DragTarget,    DragTargetAcceptEvent,    Page,    Row,    border,    colors,)def main(page: Page):    page.title = "Drag and Drop example"    def drag_will_accept(e):        e.control.content.border = border.all(            2, colors.BLACK45 if e.data == "true" else colors.RED        )        e.control.update()    def drag_accept(e: DragTargetAcceptEvent):        src = page.get_control(e.src_id)        e.control.content.bgcolor = src.content.bgcolor        e.control.content.border = None        e.control.update()    def drag_leave(e):        e.control.content.border = None        e.control.update()    page.add(        Row(            [                Column(                    [                        Draggable(                            group="color",                            content=Container(                                width=50,                                height=50,                                bgcolor=colors.CYAN,                                border_radius=5,                            ),                            content_feedback=Container(                                width=20,                                height=20,                                bgcolor=colors.CYAN,                                border_radius=3,                            ),                        ),                        Draggable(                            group="color",                            content=Container(                                width=50,                                height=50,                                bgcolor=colors.YELLOW,                                border_radius=5,                            ),                        ),                        Draggable(                            group="color1",                            content=Container(                                width=50,                                height=50,                                bgcolor=colors.GREEN,                                border_radius=5,                            ),                        ),                    ]                ),                Container(width=100),                DragTarget(                    group="color",                    content=Container(                        width=50,                        height=50,                        bgcolor=colors.BLUE_GREY_100,                        border_radius=5,                    ),                    on_will_accept=drag_will_accept,                    on_accept=drag_accept,                    on_leave=drag_leave,                ),            ]        )    )flet.app(main)
```

## Properties[​](/docs/controls/draggable#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `axis`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#axis "Direct link to axis")

The axis to restrict this draggable's movement.

When axis is set to `Axis.HORIZONTAL`, this control can only be dragged horizontally. When axis is set to `Axis.VERTICAL`, this control can only be dragged vertically.

Value is of type [`Axis`](/docs/reference/types/axis) and defaults to `None` - no restriction.

### `affinity`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#affinity "Direct link to affinity")

Controls how this control competes with other gestures to initiate a drag. If set to `None`, this widget initiates a drag as soon as it recognizes a tap down gesture, regardless of any directionality. If set to `Axis.HORIZONTAL` or `Axis.VERTICAL`, then this control will compete with other horizontal (or vertical, respectively) gestures.

Value is of type [`Axis`](/docs/reference/types/axis).

### `content`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#content "Direct link to content")

`Draggable` control displays [`content`](/docs/controls/draggable#content) when zero drags are under way. If [`content_when_dragging`](/docs/controls/draggable#content_when_dragging) is not `None`, this control instead displays `content_when_dragging` when one or more drags are underway. Otherwise, this control always displays `content`.

### `content_feedback`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#content_feedback "Direct link to content_feedback")

The `Control` to show under the pointer when a drag is under way.

### `content_when_dragging`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#content_when_dragging "Direct link to content_when_dragging")

The `Control` to display instead of `content` when one or more drags are under way.

If this is `None`, then this widget will always display `content` (and so the drag source representation will not change while a drag is under way).

### `group`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#group "Direct link to group")

A group this draggable belongs to. For [`DragTarget`](/docs/controls/dragtarget) to accept incoming drag both `Draggable` and `DragTarget` must be in the same `group`.

### `max_simultaneous_drags`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#max_simultaneous_drags "Direct link to max_simultaneous_drags")

The number of simultaneous drags to support.

-   Set this to `0` if you want to prevent the draggable from actually being dragged.
-   Set this to `1` if you want to only allow the drag source to have one item dragged at a time. In this case, consider supplying an "empty" widget for `content_when_dragging` to create the illusion of actually moving `content`.

Defaults to `None` - no limit.

## `Events`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#events "Direct link to events")

### `on_drag_complete`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#on_drag_complete "Direct link to on_drag_complete")

Fires when this draggable is dropped and accepted by a DragTarget.

### `on_drag_start`[​](/docs/controls/draggable#on_drag_start "Direct link to on_drag_start")

Fires when this draggable starts being dragged.
