# publish

This command is used to publish a Flet application as a standalone static web app using Pyodide. You can find it's guide [here](/docs/publish/web/static-website).

```
usage: flet publish [-h] [-v] [--pre] [-a ASSETS_DIR] [--distpath DISTPATH] [--app-name APP_NAME] [--app-short-name APP_SHORT_NAME] [--app-description APP_DESCRIPTION] [--base-url BASE_URL]                    [--web-renderer {canvaskit,html}] [--use-color-emoji] [--route-url-strategy {path,hash}]                    scriptPublish Flet app as a standalone web app.positional arguments:  script                path to a Python scriptoptions:  -h, --help            show this help message and exit  -v, --verbose         -v for detailed output and -vv for more detailed  --pre                 allow micropip to install pre-release Python packages  -a ASSETS_DIR, --assets ASSETS_DIR                        path to an assets directory  --distpath DISTPATH   where to put the published app (default: ./dist)  --app-name APP_NAME   application name  --app-short-name APP_SHORT_NAME                        application short name  --app-description APP_DESCRIPTION                        application description  --base-url BASE_URL   base URL for the app  --web-renderer {canvaskit,html}                        web renderer to use  --use-color-emoji     enables color emojis with CanvasKit renderer  --route-url-strategy {path,hash}                        URL routing strategy
```

# Environment variables

Below is the list of useful environment variables and their default values:

#### `FLET_APP_STORAGE_DATA`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_app_storage_data "Direct link to flet_app_storage_data")

A directory for the storage of persistent application data that is preserved between app updates. It is already pre-created and its location depends on the platform the app is running on.

#### `FLET_APP_STORAGE_TEMP`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_app_storage_temp "Direct link to flet_app_storage_temp")

A directory for the storage of temporary application files, i.e. cache. It is already pre-created and its location depends on the platform the app is running on.

#### `FLET_ASSETS_DIR`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_assets_dir "Direct link to flet_assets_dir")

Absolute path to app "assets" directory.

Defaults to `assets`.

#### `FLET_CLI_SKIP_FLUTTER_DOCTOR`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_cli_skip_flutter_doctor "Direct link to flet_cli_skip_flutter_doctor")

Whether to skip running `flutter doctor` when a build fails.

Default is `False`.

#### `FLET_FORCE_WEB_SERVER`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_force_web_server "Direct link to flet_force_web_server")

Set to `true` to force running app as a web app. Automatically set on headless Linux hosts.

#### `FLET_OAUTH_CALLBACK_HANDLER_ENDPOINT`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_oauth_callback_handler_endpoint "Direct link to flet_oauth_callback_handler_endpoint")

Custom path for OAuth handler.

Defaults to `/oauth_callback`.

#### `FLET_OAUTH_STATE_TIMEOUT`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_oauth_state_timeout "Direct link to flet_oauth_state_timeout")

Maximum allowed time (in seconds) to complete OAuth web flow.

Defaults to `600`.

#### `FLET_MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_max_upload_size "Direct link to flet_max_upload_size")

Maximum allowed size (in bytes) of uploaded files.

Default is unlimited.

#### `FLET_CLI_NO_RICH_OUTPUT`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_cli_no_rich_output "Direct link to flet_cli_no_rich_output")

Whether to disable rich output in the console.

Default is `False`.

#### `FLET_SECRET_KEY`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_secret_key "Direct link to flet_secret_key")

A secret key to sign temporary upload URLs.

#### `FLET_SERVER_IP`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_server_ip "Direct link to flet_server_ip")

IP address to listen web app on, e.g. `127.0.0.1`.

Defaults to `0.0.0.0` - bound to all server IPs.

#### `FLET_SERVER_PORT`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_server_port "Direct link to flet_server_port")

TCP port to run app on. `8000` if the program is running on a Linux server or `FLET_FORCE_WEB_SERVER` is set; otherwise random port.

#### `FLET_SESSION_TIMEOUT`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_session_timeout "Direct link to flet_session_timeout")

Session lifetime in seconds. Default is `3600`.

#### `FLET_UPLOAD_DIR`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_upload_dir "Direct link to flet_upload_dir")

Absolute path to app "upload" directory.

#### `FLET_UPLOAD_HANDLER_ENDPOINT`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_upload_handler_endpoint "Direct link to flet_upload_handler_endpoint")

Custom path for upload handler. Default is `/upload`.

#### `FLET_WEB_APP_PATH`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_web_app_path "Direct link to flet_web_app_path")

A URL path after domain name to host web app under, e.g. `/apps/myapp`. Default is `/` - host app in the root.

#### `FLET_WEBSOCKET_HANDLER_ENDPOINT`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_websocket_handler_endpoint "Direct link to flet_websocket_handler_endpoint")

Custom path for WebSocket handler. Default is `/ws`.

#### `FLET_WEB_RENDERER`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_web_renderer "Direct link to flet_web_renderer")

Web rendering mode: `canvaskit` (default), `html` or `auto`.

#### `FLET_WEB_USE_COLOR_EMOJI`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_web_use_color_emoji "Direct link to flet_web_use_color_emoji")

Set to `True`, `true` or `1` to load web font with colorful emojis.

#### `FLET_WEB_ROUTE_URL_STRATEGY`[​](/docs/reference/environment-variables#flet_web_route_url_strategy "Direct link to flet_web_route_url_strategy")

The URL strategy of the web application: `path` (default) or `hash`.

# Built-in binary Python packages for Android and iOS

Binary Python packages (vs "pure" Python packages written in Python only) are packages that partially written in C, Rust or other languages producing native code. Example packages are `numpy`, `cryptography`, or `pydantic`.

Flet provides an alternative index [https://pypi.flet.dev](https://pypi.flet.dev) to host Python binary wheels (`.whl` files downloaded by pip) for iOS and Android platforms.

This is the list of packages that are currently available for Android and iOS:

New packages can be built with creating a recipe in [Mobile Forge](https://github.com/flet-dev/mobile-forge) project. For now, Flet team is authoring those recipes for you, but when the process is polished and fully-automated you'll be able to send a PR and test the compiled package right away.

If you don't yet see a package at [https://pypi.flet.dev](https://pypi.flet.dev) you can request it in [Flet discussions - Packages](https://github.com/flet-dev/flet/discussions/categories/packages). Please do not request pure Python packages. Go to package's "Download files" section at [https://pypi.org](https://pypi.org) and make sure it contains binary platform-specific wheels.

# Alignment

Used to define an alignment relative to the center.

`Alignment` class has the following properties:

### `x`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#x "Direct link to x")

Represents the horizontal distance from the center. It's value ranges between `-1.0` and `1.0`.

### `y`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#y "Direct link to y")

Represents the vertical distance from the center. It's value ranges between `-1.0` and `1.0`.

## Pre-defined alignments[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#pre-defined-alignments "Direct link to Pre-defined alignments")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/alignment/img/docs/controls/container/container-alignments-diagram.png)

### `top_left`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#top_left "Direct link to top_left")

Represents the top left corner and is equivalent to `Alignment(-1.0, -1.0)`.

### `top_center`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#top_center "Direct link to top_center")

Represents the top center and is equivalent to `Alignment(0.0, -1.0)`.

### `top_right`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#top_right "Direct link to top_right")

Represents the top right corner and is equivalent to `Alignment(1.0, -1.0)`.

### `center_left`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#center_left "Direct link to center_left")

Represents the center left and is equivalent to `Alignment(-1.0, 0.0)`.

### `center`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#center "Direct link to center")

Represents the center and is equivalent to `Alignment(0.0, 0.0)`.

### `center_right`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#center_right "Direct link to center_right")

Represents the center right and is equivalent to `Alignment(1.0, 0.0)`.

### `bottom_left`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#bottom_left "Direct link to bottom_left")

Represents the bottom left corner and is equivalent to `Alignment(-1.0, 1.0)`.

### `bottom_center`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#bottom_center "Direct link to bottom_center")

Represents the bottom center and is equivalent to `Alignment(0.0, 1.0)`.

### `bottom_right`[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#bottom_right "Direct link to bottom_right")

Represents the bottom right corner and is equivalent to `Alignment(1.0, 1.0)`.

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/alignment#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

```
container_1.alignment = ft.alignment.centercontainer_2.alignment = ft.alignment.top_leftcontainer_3.alignment = ft.Alignment(-0.5, -0.5)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/alignment/img/docs/controls/container/containers-alignments.png)

# Animation

`Animation` has the following properties:

### `duration`[​](/docs/reference/types/animation#duration "Direct link to duration")

Gives the duration of the animation.

Value is of type `int` and defaults to `1`.

### `curve`[​](/docs/reference/types/animation#curve "Direct link to curve")

Value is of type [`AnimationCurve`](/docs/reference/types/animationcurve) or `None` and defaults to `None`.

On this page

# AnimationStyle

`AnimationStyle` class has the following properties:

### `curve`[​](/docs/reference/types/animationstyle#curve "Direct link to curve")

The curve to use for the animation.

Value is of type [`AnimationCurve`](/docs/reference/types/animationcurve).

### `duration`[​](/docs/reference/types/animationstyle#duration "Direct link to duration")

The duration of the animation.

Value is of type [`DurationValue`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#durationvalue).

### `reverse_curve`[​](/docs/reference/types/animationstyle#reverse_curve "Direct link to reverse_curve")

The curve to use for the reverse animation.

Value is of type [`AnimationCurve`](/docs/reference/types/animationcurve).

### `reverse_duration`[​](/docs/reference/types/animationstyle#reverse_duration "Direct link to reverse_duration")

The duration of the reverse animation.

Value is of type [`DurationValue`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#durationvalue).

# AutoCompleteSuggestion

`AutoCompleteSuggestion` has the following properties:

### `key`[​](/docs/reference/types/autocompletesuggestion#key "Direct link to key")

A string representing a unique identifier for the suggestion. It will be used in the filtering process of the `AutoComplete.suggestions`.

For example, if the `key` is `one 1`, the user can type `one` or `1` for this suggestion to be shown.

### `value`[​](/docs/reference/types/autocompletesuggestion#value "Direct link to value")

A string to be displayed in the suggestions list.

Ex: if `value="One"`, it will be displayed when the user's input is contained the `key`.

[Edit this page](https://github.com/flet-dev/website/edit/main/docs/reference/types/autocompletesuggestion.md)

On this page

# Badge

A Material Design "badge".

Badges are used to show notifications, counts, or status information about its control, typically an icon that is a part of a NavigationBar or a NavigationRail destination or a button's icon.

The information is shown as [`text`](/docs/reference/types/badge#text) on a badge's label. If the `text` is not provided, the badge is shown as a filled circle of [`small_size`](/docs/reference/types/badge#small_size) diameter.

If `text` is provided, the label is a StadiumBorder shaped badge with height equal to [`large_size`](/docs/reference/types/badge#large_size).

## Examples[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#examples "Direct link to Examples")

[Live example](https://flet-controls-gallery.fly.dev/displays/badge)

### Badge decorating an icon on a NavigationBar[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#badge-decorating-an-icon-on-a-navigationbar "Direct link to Badge decorating an icon on a NavigationBar")

-   Python

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    page.title = "Badge example"    page.navigation_bar = ft.NavigationBar(        destinations=[            ft.NavigationBarDestination(                icon_content=ft.Icon(                    ft.Icons.EXPLORE,                    badge=ft.Badge(small_size=10),                ),                label="Explore",            ),            ft.NavigationBarDestination(                icon=ft.Icons.COMMUTE,                label="Commute",            ),            ft.NavigationBarDestination(                icon_content=ft.Icon(                    ft.Icons.PHONE,                    badge="10",                )            ),        ]    )    page.add(ft.Text("Body!"))ft.app(main)
```

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/badge/img/docs/controls/badge/badge-navigation-bar.png)

## Properties[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#properties "Direct link to Properties")

### `alignment`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#alignment "Direct link to alignment")

Aligns the label relative to the content of the badge.

The alignment positions the label in similar way content of a container is positioned using its [`alignment`](/docs/controls/container#alignment), except that the badge alignment is resolved as if the label was a [`large_size`](/docs/reference/types/badge#large_size) square and `offset` is added to the result.

This value is only used if `text` property is provided.

For example:

```
badge.alignment = ft.alignment.top_left
```

Value is of type [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment).

### `bgcolor`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#bgcolor "Direct link to bgcolor")

Background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of the label.

### `label_visible`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#label_visible "Direct link to label_visible")

If `False`, the `label` is not displayed. By default, `label_visible` is True. It can be used to create a badge only shown under certain conditions.

Value is of type `bool`.

### `large_size`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#large_size "Direct link to large_size")

The badge's label height if `text` is provided.

If the default value is overridden then it may be useful to also override `padding` and `alignment`.

Value is of type [`OptionalNumber`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#optionalnumber) and defaults to `16`.

### `offset`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#offset "Direct link to offset")

Combined with `alignment` to determine the location of the label relative to the content.

Has effect only used if `text` is also provided.

Value is of type [`OffsetValue`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#offsetvalue).

### `padding`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#padding "Direct link to padding")

The padding added to the badge's label.

This value is only used if `text` is provided. Defaults to 4 pixels on the left and right.

Value is of type [`PaddingValue`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#paddingvalue).

### `small_size`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#small_size "Direct link to small_size")

The badge's label diameter if `text` is not provided.

Vaue is of type [`OptionalNumber`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#optionalnumber) and defaults to `6`.

### `text`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#text "Direct link to text")

The text shown on badge's label, typically 1 to 4 characters.

If the text is not provided, the badge is shown as a filled circle of [`small_size`](/docs/reference/types/badge#small_size) diameter.

If `text` is provided, the label is a StadiumBorder shaped badge with height equal to [`large_size`](/docs/reference/types/badge#large_size).

Value is of type `str`.

### `text_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#text_color "Direct link to text_color")

[Color](/docs/reference/colors) of the text shown in the label. This color overrides the color of the label's `text_style`.

### `text_style`[​](/docs/reference/types/badge#text_style "Direct link to text_style")

The text style to use for text in the label.

Value is of type [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle).

On this page

# BarChartGroup

`BarChartGroup` class has the following properties:

### `bar_rods`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartgroup#bar_rods "Direct link to bar_rods")

The list of [`BarChartRod`](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod) objects to display in the group.

### `bars_space`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartgroup#bars_space "Direct link to bars_space")

The gap between bar rods.

### `group_vertically`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartgroup#group_vertically "Direct link to group_vertically")

If set to `True` bar rods are drawn on top of each other; otherwise bar rods are drawn next to each other.

Defaults to `False`.

### `x`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartgroup#x "Direct link to x")

Group position on X axis.

# BarChartRod

`BarChartRod` class has the following properties:

### `bg_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#bg_color "Direct link to bg_color")

An optional [color](/docs/reference/colors) of a background behind this rod.

### `bg_from_y`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#bg_from_y "Direct link to bg_from_y")

An optional starting position of a background behind this rod.

### `bg_gradient`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#bg_gradient "Direct link to bg_gradient")

An optional gradient to draw a background with.

### `bg_to_y`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#bg_to_y "Direct link to bg_to_y")

An optional ending position of a background behind this rod.

### `border_radius`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#border_radius "Direct link to border_radius")

Border radius of a bar rod.

Defaults to `4`.

### `border_side`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#border_side "Direct link to border_side")

Border to draw around rod.

Value is of type [`BorderSide`](/docs/reference/types/borderside) class.

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#color "Direct link to color")

Rod [color](/docs/reference/colors).

Defaults to `Colors.CYAN`.

### `from_y`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#from_y "Direct link to from_y")

Specifies a starting position of this rod on Y axis.

Defaults to `0`.

### `gradient`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#gradient "Direct link to gradient")

Gradient to draw rod's background.

Value is of type [`Gradient`](/docs/reference/types/gradient).

### `rod_stack_items`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#rod_stack_items "Direct link to rod_stack_items")

Optional list of [`BarChartRodStackItem`](/docs/reference/types/barchartrodstackitem) objects to draw a stacked bar.

### `selected`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#selected "Direct link to selected")

If set to `True` a tooltip is always shown on top of the bar when `BarChart.interactive` is set to `False`.

### `show_tooltip`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#show_tooltip "Direct link to show_tooltip")

Whether a tooltip should be shown on top of hovered bar.

Defaults to `True`.

### `to_y`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#to_y "Direct link to to_y")

Specifies an ending position of this rod on Y axis.

### `tooltip`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#tooltip "Direct link to tooltip")

A custom tooltip value.

Defaults to `to_y`.

### `tooltip_align`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#tooltip_align "Direct link to tooltip_align")

An align for the tooltip.

Value is of type [`TextAlign`](/docs/reference/types/textalign).

### `tooltip_style`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#tooltip_style "Direct link to tooltip_style")

A text style to display tooltip with.

Value is of type [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle).

### `width`[​](/docs/reference/types/barchartrod#width "Direct link to width")

The width of this rod.

Defaults to `8`.

# Border

`Border` class has the following properties describing 4 sides of the rectangle:

### `bottom`[​](/docs/reference/types/border#bottom "Direct link to bottom")

### `left`[​](/docs/reference/types/border#left "Direct link to left")

### `right`[​](/docs/reference/types/border#right "Direct link to right")

### `top`[​](/docs/reference/types/border#top "Direct link to top")

## Helper methods[​](/docs/reference/types/border#helper-methods "Direct link to Helper methods")

Each side of the border is described by an instance of [`BorderSide`](/docs/reference/types/borderside) class.

The below helper methods are available to ease the creation of `Border` objects:

### `border.all(width, color)`[​](/docs/reference/types/border#borderallwidth-color "Direct link to borderallwidth-color")

Sets the same border for all 4 sides of the rectangle.

### `border.symmetric(vertical, horizontal)`[​](/docs/reference/types/border#bordersymmetricvertical-horizontal "Direct link to bordersymmetricvertical-horizontal")

Sets `vertical` border for top and bottom sides and `horizontal` for the left and right sides of the rectangle.

### `border.only(left: BorderSide, top: BorderSide, right: BorderSide, bottom: BorderSide)`[​](/docs/reference/types/border#borderonlyleft-borderside-top-borderside-right-borderside-bottom-borderside "Direct link to borderonlyleft-borderside-top-borderside-right-borderside-bottom-borderside")

Sets different borders for each side of the rectangle.

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/border#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

```
container_1.border = ft.border.all(10, ft.Colors.PINK_600)container_1.border = ft.border.only(bottom=ft.border.BorderSide(1, "black"))
```

# BorderRadius

`BorderRadius` class has the following properties describing 4 corner values:

### `top_left`[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#top_left "Direct link to top_left")

### `top_right`[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#top_right "Direct link to top_right")

### `bottom_left`[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#bottom_left "Direct link to bottom_left")

### `bottom_right`[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#bottom_right "Direct link to bottom_right")

## Helper methods[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#helper-methods "Direct link to Helper methods")

The object could be created with a constructor where all corner values set separately or with helper methods:

### `ft.border_radius.all(value)`[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#ftborder_radiusallvalue "Direct link to ftborder_radiusallvalue")

Sets the same border radius of `value` for all 4 corners of the rectangle.

### `ft.border_radius.horizontal(left, right)`[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#ftborder_radiushorizontalleft-right "Direct link to ftborder_radiushorizontalleft-right")

Sets the border radius horizontally for the left and right corners of the rectangle.

Both `left` and `right` default to `0`.

### `ft.border_radius.vertical(top: float = 0, bottom: float = 0)`[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#ftborder_radiusverticaltop-float--0-bottom-float--0 "Direct link to ftborder_radiusverticaltop-float--0-bottom-float--0")

Sets the border radius vertically for the top and bottom corners of the rectangle.

Both `top` and `bottom` default to `0`.

### `ft.border_radius.only(top_left, top_right, bottom_left, bottom_right)`[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#ftborder_radiusonlytop_left-top_right-bottom_left-bottom_right "Direct link to ftborder_radiusonlytop_left-top_right-bottom_left-bottom_right")

Sets different border radius for each corner of the rectangle.

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/borderradius#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

```
container_1.border_radius= ft.border_radius.all(30)
```

# BorderSide

`BorderSide` class has the following properties:

[Color](/docs/reference/colors) of the border.

Stroke alignment of the border.

Value is of type `float` or [`BorderSideStrokeAlign`](/docs/reference/types/bordersidestrokealign).

### `width`[​](/docs/reference/types/borderside#width "Direct link to width")

Width of the border.

On this page

# BoxShadow

`BoxShadow` class has the following properties:

### `blur_radius`[​](/docs/reference/types/boxshadow#blur_radius "Direct link to blur_radius")

The standard deviation of the Gaussian to convolve with the shadow's shape.

Defaults to `0.0.`.

### `blur_style`[​](/docs/reference/types/boxshadow#blur_style "Direct link to blur_style")

Value is of type [`ShadowBlurStyle`](/docs/reference/types/shadowblurstyle) and defaults to `ShadowBlurStyle.NORMAL`.

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/boxshadow#color "Direct link to color")

[Color](/docs/reference/colors) used to draw the shadow.

### `offset`[​](/docs/reference/types/boxshadow#offset "Direct link to offset")

An instance of `Offset` class - the displacement of the shadow from the casting element. Positive x/y offsets will shift the shadow to the right and down, while negative offsets shift the shadow to the left and up. The offsets are relative to the position of the element that is casting it.

Value is of type [`Offset`](/docs/reference/types/offset) and defaults to `Offset(0,0)`.

### `spread_radius`[​](/docs/reference/types/boxshadow#spread_radius "Direct link to spread_radius")

The amount the box should be inflated prior to applying the blur.

Defaults to `0.0.`.

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/boxshadow#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

```
ft.Container(    border_radius=10,    width=100,    height=100,    shadow=ft.BoxShadow(        spread_radius=1,        blur_radius=15,        color=ft.Colors.BLUE_GREY_300,        offset=ft.Offset(0, 0),        blur_style=ft.ShadowBlurStyle.OUTER,    ))
```

# BoxConstraints

`BoxConstraints` class has the following properties:

### `max_height`[​](/docs/reference/types/boxconstraints#max_height "Direct link to max_height")

The maximum height that satisfies the constraints, such that `min_height <= max_height <= float("inf")`.

Value is of type [`Number`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#number) and defaults to `float("inf")` - infinity.

### `max_width`[​](/docs/reference/types/boxconstraints#max_width "Direct link to max_width")

The maximum width that satisfies the constraints, such that `min_width <= max_width <= float("inf")`.

Value is of type [`Number`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#number) and defaults to `float("inf")` - infinity.

### `min_height`[​](/docs/reference/types/boxconstraints#min_height "Direct link to min_height")

The minimum height that satisfies the constraints, such that `0.0 <= min_height <= max_height`.

Value is of type [`Number`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#number) and defaults to `0.0`.

### `min_width`[​](/docs/reference/types/boxconstraints#min_width "Direct link to min_width")

The minimum width that satisfies the constraints, such that `0.0 <= min_width <= max_width`.

Value is of type [`Number`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#number) and defaults to `0.0`.

[Edit this page](https://github.com/flet-dev/website/edit/main/docs/reference/types/boxconstraints.md)

# ButtonStyle

Allows controlling all visual aspects of a button, such as shape, foreground, background and shadow colors, content padding, border width and radius.

Most of these style attributes could be configured for all or particular [`ControlState`](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) of a button, such as `HOVERED`, `FOCUSED`, `DISABLED` and others.

`ButtonStyle` class has the following properties:

### `alignment`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#alignment "Direct link to alignment")

The alignment of the button's content.

Value is of type [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment).

### `animation_duration`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#animation_duration "Direct link to animation_duration")

Defines the duration in milliseconds of animated changes for shape and elevation.

### `bgcolor`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#bgcolor "Direct link to bgcolor")

The button's background fill color.

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#color "Direct link to color")

The color for the button's Text and Icon control descendants.

### `elevation`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#elevation "Direct link to elevation")

The elevation of the button's Material.

### `enable_feedback`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#enable_feedback "Direct link to enable_feedback")

Whether detected gestures should provide acoustic and/or haptic feedback.

Value is of type `bool`.

### `icon_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#icon_color "Direct link to icon_color")

The icon's [color](/docs/reference/colors) inside the button. If not set or `None`, then the `color` will be used.

### `icon_size`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#icon_size "Direct link to icon_size")

The icon's size inside of the button.

### `mouse_cursor`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#mouse_cursor "Direct link to mouse_cursor")

The cursor to be displayed when the mouse pointer enters or is hovering over the button.

### `overlay_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#overlay_color "Direct link to overlay_color")

The highlight color that's typically used to indicate that the button is focused, hovered, or pressed.

### `shadow_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#shadow_color "Direct link to shadow_color")

The shadow color of the button's Material.

### `surface_tint_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#surface_tint_color "Direct link to surface_tint_color")

The surface tint color of the button's Material.

### `padding`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#padding "Direct link to padding")

The padding between the button's boundary and its content.

Value is of type [`Padding`](/docs/reference/types/padding).

### `shape`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#shape "Direct link to shape")

The shape of the button's underlying Material.

Value is of type [`OutlinedBorder`](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder).

### `side`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#side "Direct link to side")

An instance of [`BorderSide`](/docs/reference/types/borderside) class, the color and weight of the button's outline.

### `text_style`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#text_style "Direct link to text_style")

The text style of the button's `Text` control descendants.

Value is of type [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle).

### `visual_density`[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#visual_density "Direct link to visual_density")

Defines how compact the button's layout will be.

Value is of type [`VisualDensity`](/docs/reference/types/visualdensity).

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

You can configure a different shape, background color for a hovered state and configure fallback values for all other states.

To configure style attribute for all Material states set its value to a literal (or class instance). For example, if you set `color` property to a literal the value will be applied to all button states:

```
ButtonStyle(    color=ft.Colors.WHITE)
```

To configure style attribute for specific Material states set its value to a dictionary where the key is state name. For example, to configure different background colors for `HOVERED` and `FOCUSED` states and another colors for all other states:

```
ButtonStyle(    color={        ft.ControlState.HOVERED: ft.Colors.WHITE,        ft.ControlState.FOCUSED: ft.Colors.BLUE,        ft.ControlState.DEFAULT: ft.Colors.BLACK,    })
```

### Various button shapes example[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#various-button-shapes-example "Direct link to Various button shapes example")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle/img/blog/gradients/button-shapes.png)

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    page.padding = 30    page.spacing = 30    page.add(        ft.FilledButton(            "Stadium",            style=ft.ButtonStyle(                shape=ft.StadiumBorder(),            ),        ),        ft.FilledButton(            "Rounded rectangle",            style=ft.ButtonStyle(                shape=ft.RoundedRectangleBorder(radius=10),            ),        ),        ft.FilledButton(            "Continuous rectangle",            style=ft.ButtonStyle(                shape=ft.ContinuousRectangleBorder(radius=30),            ),        ),        ft.FilledButton(            "Beveled rectangle",            style=ft.ButtonStyle(                shape=ft.BeveledRectangleBorder(radius=10),            ),        ),        ft.FilledButton(            "Circle",            style=ft.ButtonStyle(shape=ft.CircleBorder(), padding=30),        ),    )ft.app(main)
```

### Styled button example[​](/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle#styled-button-example "Direct link to Styled button example")

Check the following example:

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/buttonstyle/img/blog/gradients/styled-button.gif)

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    page.add(        ft.ElevatedButton(            "Styled button 1",            style=ft.ButtonStyle(                color={                    ft.ControlState.HOVERED: ft.Colors.WHITE,                    ft.ControlState.FOCUSED: ft.Colors.BLUE,                    ft.ControlState.DEFAULT: ft.Colors.BLACK,                },                bgcolor={ft.ControlState.FOCUSED: ft.Colors.PINK_200, "": ft.Colors.YELLOW},                padding={ft.ControlState.HOVERED: 20},                overlay_color=ft.Colors.TRANSPARENT,                elevation={"pressed": 0, "": 1},                animation_duration=500,                side={                    ft.ControlState.DEFAULT: ft.BorderSide(1, ft.Colors.BLUE),                    ft.ControlState.HOVERED: ft.BorderSide(2, ft.Colors.BLUE),                },                shape={                    ft.ControlState.HOVERED: ft.RoundedRectangleBorder(radius=20),                    ft.ControlState.DEFAULT: ft.RoundedRectangleBorder(radius=2),                },            ),        )    )ft.app(main)
```

# ChartAxis

Configures chart axis.

`ChartAxis` class has the following properties:

### `labels`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis#labels "Direct link to labels")

The list of [`ChartAxisLabel`](/docs/reference/types/chartaxislabel) objects to set custom axis labels for only specific values.

### `labels_interval`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis#labels_interval "Direct link to labels_interval")

The interval between automatic labels.

### `labels_size`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis#labels_size "Direct link to labels_size")

Width or height of labels area.

### `show_labels`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis#show_labels "Direct link to show_labels")

If `True`, displays the `labels` along the axis. If `labels` is empty then automatic labels are displayed.

### `title`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis#title "Direct link to title")

A `Control` to display as axis title.

### `title_size`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartaxis#title_size "Direct link to title_size")

Width or height of title area.

# ChartAxisLabel

Configures a custom label for specific value.

`ChartAxisLabel` class has the following properties:

### `label`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartaxislabel#label "Direct link to label")

A `Control` to draw as a label.

### `value`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartaxislabel#value "Direct link to value")

A value to draw label for.

# ChartCirclePoint

`ChartCirclePoint` class has the following properties:

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartcirclepoint#color "Direct link to color")

The fill [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use for the circle.

### `radius`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartcirclepoint#radius "Direct link to radius")

The radius of the circle.

### `stroke_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartcirclepoint#stroke_color "Direct link to stroke_color")

The stroke [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use for the circle

### `stroke_width`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartcirclepoint#stroke_width "Direct link to stroke_width")

The stroke width to use for the circle.

Defaults to `1.0`.

# ChartCrossPoint

`ChartCrossPoint` class has the following properties:

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartcrosspoint#color "Direct link to color")

The fill [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use for the cross-mark(X).

### `size`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartcrosspoint#size "Direct link to size")

The size of the cross-mark.

Defaults to `8.0`.

### `width`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartcrosspoint#width "Direct link to width")

The thickness of the cross-mark.

Defaults to `2.0`.

On this page

# ChartGridLines

Configures the appearance of horizontal and vertical grid lines within the chart.

`ChartGridLines` class has the following properties:

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartgridlines#color "Direct link to color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) of a grid line.

### `dash_pattern`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartgridlines#dash_pattern "Direct link to dash_pattern")

Defines dash effect of the line. The value is a circular list of dash offsets and lengths. For example, the list `[5, 10]` would result in dashes 5 pixels long followed by blank spaces 10 pixels long. By default, a solid line is drawn.

### `interval`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartgridlines#interval "Direct link to interval")

The interval between grid lines.

Defaults to `1`.

### `width`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartgridlines#width "Direct link to width")

The width of a grid line.

Defaults to `1`.

[Edit this page](https://github.com/flet-dev/website/edit/main/docs/reference/types/chartgridlines.md)

# ChartPointLine

`ChartPointLine` class has the following properties:

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartpointline#color "Direct link to color")

The line's [color](/docs/reference/colors).

### `dash_pattern`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartpointline#dash_pattern "Direct link to dash_pattern")

The line's dash pattern.

### `width`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartpointline#width "Direct link to width")

The line's width.

On this page

# ChartSquarePoint

`ChartSquarePoint` class has the following properties:

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartsquarepoint#color "Direct link to color")

The fill [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use for the square.

### `size`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartsquarepoint#size "Direct link to size")

The size of the square.

Defaults to `4.0`.

### `stroke_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartsquarepoint#stroke_color "Direct link to stroke_color")

The stroke [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use for the square.

### `stroke_width`[​](/docs/reference/types/chartsquarepoint#stroke_width "Direct link to stroke_width")

The stroke width to use for the square.

Defaults to `1.0`.

# ColorFilter

Defines a color filter that can be used with [`Container.color_filter`](/docs/controls/container#color_filter).

`ColorFilter` class has the following properties:

### `blend_mode`[​](/docs/reference/types/colorfilter#blend_mode "Direct link to blend_mode")

The blend mode to apply to the color filter.

Value is of type [`BlendMode`](/docs/reference/types/blendmode).

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/colorfilter#color "Direct link to color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use when applying the filter.

# DecorationImage

`DecorationImage` has the following properties:

### `alignment`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#alignment "Direct link to alignment")

The alignment of the image within its bounds.

Value is of type [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment) and defaults to `Alignment(0.0, 0.0)`.

### `anti_alias`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#anti_alias "Direct link to anti_alias")

Whether to paint the image in anti-aliased quality.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

### `color_filter`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#color_filter "Direct link to color_filter")

A color filter to apply to the image before painting it.

Value is of type [`ColorFilter`](/docs/reference/types/colorfilter).

### `filter_quality`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#filter_quality "Direct link to filter_quality")

The quality of the image filter.

Value is of type [`FilterQuality`](/docs/reference/types/filterquality) and defaults to `FilterQuality.MEDIUM`.

### `fit`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#fit "Direct link to fit")

How the image should be inscribed into the box.

Value is of type [`ImageFit`](/docs/reference/types/imagefit).

### `invert_colors`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#invert_colors "Direct link to invert_colors")

Whether to invert the colors of the image while drawing.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

### `match_text_direction`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#match_text_direction "Direct link to match_text_direction")

Whether to paint the image in the direction of the TextDirection.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

### `opacity`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#opacity "Direct link to opacity")

The opacity of the image.

Value is of type `float` and defaults to `1.0`.

### `repeat`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#repeat "Direct link to repeat")

How the image should be repeated to fill the box.

Value is of type [`ImageRepeat`](/docs/reference/types/imagerepeat) and defaults to `ImageRepeat.NO_REPEAT`.

### `src`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#src "Direct link to src")

The image to paint.

### `src_base64`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#src_base64 "Direct link to src_base64")

The base64-encoded image to paint.

### `scale`[​](/docs/reference/types/decorationimage#scale "Direct link to scale")

The scale(image pixels to be shown per logical pixels) to apply to the image.

Value is of type `float` and defaults to `1.0`.

The number of microseconds in the duration.

### `milliseconds`[​](/docs/reference/types/duration#milliseconds "Direct link to milliseconds")

The number of milliseconds in the duration.

### `minutes`[​](/docs/reference/types/duration#minutes "Direct link to minutes")

The number of minutes in the duration.

### `seconds`[​](/docs/reference/types/duration#seconds "Direct link to seconds")

The number of seconds in the duration.

# FilePickerFile

`FilePickerFile` class has the following properties:

### `name`[​](/docs/reference/types/filepickerfile#name "Direct link to name")

File name without a path.

### `path`[​](/docs/reference/types/filepickerfile#path "Direct link to path")

Full path to a file. Works for desktop and mobile only. `None` on web.

### `size`[​](/docs/reference/types/filepickerfile#size "Direct link to size")

File size in bytes.

On this page

# GeolocatorAndroidSettings

`GeolocatorAndroidSettings` class has the following values:

### `accuracy`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#accuracy "Direct link to accuracy")

The accuracy of the location data.

Value is of type [`GeolocatorPositionAccuracy`](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorpositionaccuracy) and defaults to `GeolocatorPositionAccuracy.BEST`.

### `distance_filter`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#distance_filter "Direct link to distance_filter")

The minimum distance (measured in meters) a device must move horizontally before an update event is generated.

Value is of type `int` and defaults to `0`.

### `force_location_manager`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#force_location_manager "Direct link to force_location_manager")

Forces the Geolocator plugin to use the legacy LocationManager instead of the FusedLocationProviderClient.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

### `foreground_notification_text`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#foreground_notification_text "Direct link to foreground_notification_text")

The body used for the foreground service notification.

### `foreground_notification_title`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#foreground_notification_title "Direct link to foreground_notification_title")

The title used for the foreground service notification.

### `foreground_notification_enable_wake_lock`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#foreground_notification_enable_wake_lock "Direct link to foreground_notification_enable_wake_lock")

Whether wakelock should be acquired when background execution is started. If this is `False` then the system can still sleep and all location events will be received at once when the system wakes up again.

Wake lock permissions should be obtained first by using [`PermissionHandler`](/docs/controls/permissionhandler).

Has no effect if `foreground_notification_text` or `foreground_notification_title` are not set.

Defaults to `False`.

### `foreground_notification_enable_wifi_lock`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#foreground_notification_enable_wifi_lock "Direct link to foreground_notification_enable_wifi_lock")

Whether WifiLock is acquired when background execution is started. This allows the application to keep the Wi-Fi radio awake, even when the user has not used the device in a while (e. g. for background network communications).

Wifi lock permissions should be obtained first by using [`PermissionHandler`](/docs/controls/permissionhandler).

Has no effect if `foreground_notification_text` or `foreground_notification_title` are not set.

Defaults to `False`.

### `foreground_notification_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#foreground_notification_color "Direct link to foreground_notification_color")

Accent [color](/docs/reference/colors) to be applied by the standard Style templates when presenting the notification.

Has no effect if `foreground_notification_text` or `foreground_notification_title` are not set.

### `foreground_notification_channel_name`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#foreground_notification_channel_name "Direct link to foreground_notification_channel_name")

The user visible name of the notification channel. The notification channel name will be displayed in the system settings. The maximum recommended length is 40 characters, the name might be truncated if it is to long.

Has no effect if `foreground_notification_text` or `foreground_notification_title` are not set.

Value is of type `str` and defaults to `"Background Location"`.

### `foreground_notification_set_ongoing`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#foreground_notification_set_ongoing "Direct link to foreground_notification_set_ongoing")

Whether the displayed notification is persistent and the user cannot dismiss it.

Has no effect if `foreground_notification_text` or `foreground_notification_title` are not set.

Defaults to `True`.

### `interval_duration`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#interval_duration "Direct link to interval_duration")

The desired interval for active location updates.

Value is of type [`Duration`](/docs/reference/types/duration) and defaults to 5000 milliseconds.

### `time_limit`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#time_limit "Direct link to time_limit")

The timeout interval for the location request. By default there's no time limit.

Value is of type [`Duration`](/docs/reference/types/duration).

### `use_mls_altitude`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings#use_mls_altitude "Direct link to use_mls_altitude")

Whether the altitude should be calculated as MSL (EGM2008) from NMEA messages and reported as the altitude instead of using the geoidal height (WSG84). Setting this property true will help to align Android altitude to that of iOS which uses MSL.

This property only works with position stream updates ([`Geolocator.on_position_change`](/docs/controls/geolocator#on_position_change)) and has no effect when getting the current position or last known position.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

On this page

# GeolocatorAppleSettings

`GeolocatorAppleSettings` class has the following values:

### `accuracy`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorapplesettings#accuracy "Direct link to accuracy")

The accuracy of the location data.

Value is of type [`GeolocatorPositionAccuracy`](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorpositionaccuracy) and defaults to `GeolocatorPositionAccuracy.BEST`.

### `activity_type`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorapplesettings#activity_type "Direct link to activity_type")

The location manager uses the information in this property as a cue to determine when location updates may be automatically paused.

Value is of type [`GeolocatorActivityType`](/docs/reference/types/geolocatoractivitytype) and defaults to `GeolocatorActivityType.OTHER`.

### `allow_background_location_updates`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorapplesettings#allow_background_location_updates "Direct link to allow_background_location_updates")

Whether to allow the app to receive location updates in the background.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `True`.

### `distance_filter`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorapplesettings#distance_filter "Direct link to distance_filter")

The minimum distance (measured in meters) a device must move horizontally before an update event is generated.

Value is of type `int` and defaults to `0`.

### `show_background_location_indicator`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorapplesettings#show_background_location_indicator "Direct link to show_background_location_indicator")

Flag to ask the Apple OS to show the background location indicator (iOS only) if app starts up and background and requests the users location. For this setting to work and for the location to be retrieved the user must have granted "always" permissions for location retrieval.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

### `time_limit`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorapplesettings#time_limit "Direct link to time_limit")

The timeout interval for the location request. By default there's no time limit.

Value is of type [`Duration`](/docs/reference/types/duration).

### `pause_location_updates_automatically`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorapplesettings#pause_location_updates_automatically "Direct link to pause_location_updates_automatically")

Allows the location manager to pause updates to improve battery life on the target device without sacrificing location data. When this property is set to `True`, the location manager pauses updates (and powers down the appropriate hardware) at times when the location data is unlikely to change.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `False`.

On this page

# GeolocatorPosition

`GeolocatorPosition` class has the following values:

### `accuracy`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#accuracy "Direct link to accuracy")

The estimated horizontal accuracy of the position in meters.

### `altitude`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#altitude "Direct link to altitude")

The altitude of the device in meters.

### `altitude_accuracy`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#altitude_accuracy "Direct link to altitude_accuracy")

The estimated vertical accuracy of the position in meters.

### `floor`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#floor "Direct link to floor")

The floor specifies the floor of the building on which the device is located.

### `heading`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#heading "Direct link to heading")

The heading in which the device is traveling in degrees.

### `heading_accuracy`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#heading_accuracy "Direct link to heading_accuracy")

The estimated heading accuracy of the position in degrees.

### `is_mocked`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#is_mocked "Direct link to is_mocked")

Will be true on Android (starting from API lvl 18) when the location came from the mocked provider.

### `latitude`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#latitude "Direct link to latitude")

The latitude of this position in degrees normalized to the interval -90.0 to +90.0 (both inclusive).

### `longitude`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#longitude "Direct link to longitude")

The longitude of the position in degrees normalized to the interval -180 (exclusive) to +180 (inclusive).

### `speed`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#speed "Direct link to speed")

The speed at which the devices is traveling in meters per second over ground.

### `speed_accuracy`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#speed_accuracy "Direct link to speed_accuracy")

The estimated speed accuracy of this position, in meters per second.

### `timestamp`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorposition#timestamp "Direct link to timestamp")

The time at which this position was determined.

# GeolocatorSettings

Parent to the following classes:

-   [`GeolocatorWebSettings`](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorwebsettings)
-   [`GeolocatorAndroidSettings`](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorandroidsettings)
-   [`GeolocatorAppleSettings`](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorapplesettings)

`GeolocatorSettings` class has the following values:

### `accuracy`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorsettings#accuracy "Direct link to accuracy")

The accuracy of the location data.

Value is of type [`GeolocatorPositionAccuracy`](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorpositionaccuracy) and defaults to `GeolocatorPositionAccuracy.BEST`.

### `distance_filter`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorsettings#distance_filter "Direct link to distance_filter")

The minimum distance (measured in meters) a device must move horizontally before an update event is generated.

Value is of type `int` and defaults to `0`.

### `time_limit`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorsettings#time_limit "Direct link to time_limit")

The timeout interval for the location request. By default there's no time limit.

Value is of type [`Duration`](/docs/reference/types/duration).

# GeolocatorWebSettings

`GeolocatorWebSettings` class has the following values:

### `accuracy`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorwebsettings#accuracy "Direct link to accuracy")

The accuracy of the location data.

Value is of type [`GeolocatorPositionAccuracy`](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorpositionaccuracy) and defaults to `GeolocatorPositionAccuracy.BEST`.

### `distance_filter`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorwebsettings#distance_filter "Direct link to distance_filter")

The minimum distance (measured in meters) a device must move horizontally before an update event is generated.

Value is of type `int` and defaults to `0`.

### `maximum_age`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorwebsettings#maximum_age "Direct link to maximum_age")

A value indicating the maximum age of a possible cached position that is acceptable to return. If set to 0, it means that the device cannot use a cached position and must attempt to retrieve the real current position.

Value is of type [`Duration`](/docs/reference/types/duration) and defaults to `0`.

### `time_limit`[​](/docs/reference/types/geolocatorwebsettings#time_limit "Direct link to time_limit")

The timeout interval for the location request. By default there's no time limit.

Value is of type [`Duration`](/docs/reference/types/duration).

On this page

# InputFilter

Prevents the insertion of characters matching (or not matching) a particular pattern(`regex_string`), by replacing the characters with the given `replacement_string`.

`InputFilter` class takes 3 parameters:

### `allow`[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#allow "Direct link to allow")

A boolean value indicating whether to allow or deny/block the matched patterns.

Value is of type `bool` and defaults to `True`.

### `case_sensitive`[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#case_sensitive "Direct link to case_sensitive")

Whether this regular expression is case sensitive.

If the regular expression is not case sensitive, it will match an input letter with a pattern letter even if the two letters are different case versions of the same letter.

### `dot_all`[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#dot_all "Direct link to dot_all")

Whether "." in this regular expression matches line terminators.

When false, the "." character matches a single character, unless that character terminates a line. When true, then the "." character will match any single character including line terminators.

This feature is distinct from `multiline`. They affect the behavior of different pattern characters, so they can be used together or separately.

### `multiline`[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#multiline "Direct link to multiline")

Whether this regular expression matches multiple lines.

If the regexp does match multiple lines, the "^" and "$" characters match the beginning and end of lines. If not, the characters match the beginning and end of the input.

### `regex_string`[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#regex_string "Direct link to regex_string")

A regular expression pattern for the filter.

It is recommended to use raw strings (prefix your string with `r`) for the pattern, ex: `r"pattern"`.

### `replacement_string`[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#replacement_string "Direct link to replacement_string")

A string used to replace banned/denied patterns. Defaults to an empty string.

### `unicode`[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#unicode "Direct link to unicode")

Whether this regular expression uses Unicode mode.

## Predefined input filters[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#predefined-input-filters "Direct link to Predefined input filters")

### `NumbersOnlyInputFilter()`[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#numbersonlyinputfilter "Direct link to numbersonlyinputfilter")

Allows only numbers.

### `TextOnlyInputFilter()`[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#textonlyinputfilter "Direct link to textonlyinputfilter")

Allows only text.

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/inputfilter#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

```
ft.CupertinoTextField(    placeholder_text="Only numbers are allowed",    input_filter=ft.InputFilter(allow=True, regex_string=r"^[0-9]*$", replacement_string=""))
```

```
ft.TextField(    label="Only letters are allowed",    input_filter=ft.TextOnlyInputFilter())
```

# LineChartData

`LineChartData` class has the following properties:

### `above_line`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#above_line "Direct link to above_line")

A vertical line drawn between a line point and the top edge of the chart.

Value is of type [`ChartPointLine`](/docs/reference/types/chartpointline).

### `above_line_bgcolor`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#above_line_bgcolor "Direct link to above_line_bgcolor")

Fill the area above chart line with the specified [color](/docs/reference/colors).

### `above_line_cutoff_y`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#above_line_cutoff_y "Direct link to above_line_cutoff_y")

Cut off filled area above line chart at specific Y value.

### `above_line_gradient`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#above_line_gradient "Direct link to above_line_gradient")

Fill the area above chart line with the specified gradient.

### `below_line`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#below_line "Direct link to below_line")

A vertical line drawn between a line point and the bottom edge of the chart.

Value is of type [`ChartPointLine`](/docs/reference/types/chartpointline).

### `below_line_bgcolor`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#below_line_bgcolor "Direct link to below_line_bgcolor")

Fill the area below chart line with the specified [color](/docs/reference/colors).

### `below_line_cutoff_y`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#below_line_cutoff_y "Direct link to below_line_cutoff_y")

Cut off filled area below line chart at specific Y value.

### `below_line_gradient`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#below_line_gradient "Direct link to below_line_gradient")

Fill the area below chart line with the specified gradient.

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#color "Direct link to color")

A [color](/docs/reference/colors) of chart line.

### `curved`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#curved "Direct link to curved")

Set to `True` to draw chart line as a curve.

Defaults to `False`.

### `dash_pattern`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#dash_pattern "Direct link to dash_pattern")

Defines dash effect of the line. The value is a circular list of dash offsets and lengths. For example, the list `[5, 10]` would result in dashes 5 pixels long followed by blank spaces 10 pixels long. By default, a solid line is drawn.

### `data_points`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#data_points "Direct link to data_points")

A list of points (dots) of [`LineChartDataPoint`](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint) type representing a single chart line.

### `gradient`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#gradient "Direct link to gradient")

Gradient to draw line's background.

Value is of type [`Gradient`](/docs/reference/types/gradient).

### `point`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#point "Direct link to point")

Defines the appearance and shape of a line point (dot).

Value is of type bool (`True` - draw a point with default style or `False` - do not draw a line point) or of type [`ChartPointShape`](/docs/reference/types/chartpointshape).

### `prevent_curve_over_shooting`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#prevent_curve_over_shooting "Direct link to prevent_curve_over_shooting")

Whether to prevent overshooting when draw curve line on linear sequence spots.

Defaults to `False`.

### `prevent_curve_over_shooting_threshold`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#prevent_curve_over_shooting_threshold "Direct link to prevent_curve_over_shooting_threshold")

Threshold to prevent overshooting algorithm.

Defaults to `10.0`.

### `shadow`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#shadow "Direct link to shadow")

Shadow to drop by a chart line.

Value is of type [`BoxShadow`](/docs/reference/types/boxshadow).

### `selected_below_line`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#selected_below_line "Direct link to selected_below_line")

A vertical line drawn between selected line point and the bottom adge of the chart. The value is either `True` - draw a line with default style, `False` - do not draw a line under selected point, or an instance of [`ChartPointLine`](/docs/reference/types/chartpointline) class to specify line style to draw.

### `selected_point`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#selected_point "Direct link to selected_point")

Defines the appearance and shape of a selected line point.

Value is of type [`ChartPointShape`](/docs/reference/types/chartpointshape).

### `stroke_cap_round`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#stroke_cap_round "Direct link to stroke_cap_round")

Set to `True` to draw rounded line caps.

Defaults to `False`.

### `stroke_width`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdata#stroke_width "Direct link to stroke_width")

The width of a chart line.

# LineChartDataPoint

`LineChartDataPoint` class has the following properties:

### `point`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#point "Direct link to point")

Defines the appearance and shape of a line point.

Value is of type [`ChartPointShape`](/docs/reference/types/chartpointshape).

### `selected`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#selected "Direct link to selected")

Draw the point as selected when `LineChart.interactive` is set to False.

### `selected_below_line`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#selected_below_line "Direct link to selected_below_line")

A vertical line drawn between selected line point and the bottom adge of the chart. The value is either `True` - draw a line with default style, `False` - do not draw a line under selected point, or an instance of [`ChartPointLine`](/docs/reference/types/chartpointline) class to specify line style to draw.

### `selected_point`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#selected_point "Direct link to selected_point")

Defines the appearance and shape of a selected line point.

Value is of type [`ChartPointShape`](/docs/reference/types/chartpointshape).

### `show_above_line`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#show_above_line "Direct link to show_above_line")

Whether to display a line above data point.

Defaults to `True`.

### `show_below_line`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#show_below_line "Direct link to show_below_line")

Whether to display a line below data point.

Defaults to `True`.

### `show_tooltip`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#show_tooltip "Direct link to show_tooltip")

Whether a tooltip should be shown on top of hovered data point.

Defaults to `True`.

### `tooltip`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#tooltip "Direct link to tooltip")

A custom tooltip value.

Default is `y`.

### `tooltip_align`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#tooltip_align "Direct link to tooltip_align")

An align for the tooltip.

Value is of type [`TextAlign`](/docs/reference/types/textalign).

### `tooltip_style`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#tooltip_style "Direct link to tooltip_style")

A text style to display tooltip with.

Value is of type [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle).

### `x`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#x "Direct link to x")

The position of a point on `X` axis.

### `y`[​](/docs/reference/types/linechartdatapoint#y "Direct link to y")

The position of a point on `Y` axis.

On this page

# LinearGradient

`LinearGradient` class has the following properties:

### `begin`[​](/docs/reference/types/lineargradient#begin "Direct link to begin")

An instance of [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment). The offset at which stop `0.0` of the gradient is placed.

### `colors`[​](/docs/reference/types/lineargradient#colors "Direct link to colors")

The [`colors`](/docs/reference/colors) the gradient should obtain at each of the stops. This list must contain at least two colors.

If `stops` is provided, this list must have the same length as `stops`.

### `end`[​](/docs/reference/types/lineargradient#end "Direct link to end")

An instance of [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment). The offset at which stop `1.0` of the gradient is placed.

### `rotation`[​](/docs/reference/types/lineargradient#rotation "Direct link to rotation")

The rotation of the gradient in [radians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radian), around the center-point of its bounding box.

More information on Linear gradient [here](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/painting/LinearGradient-class.html).

### `stops`[​](/docs/reference/types/lineargradient#stops "Direct link to stops")

A list of values from `0.0` to `1.0` that denote fractions along the gradient.

If provided, this list must have the same length as `colors`. If the first value is not `0.0`, then a stop with position `0.0` and a color equal to the first color in `colors` is implied. If the last value is not `1.0`, then a stop with position `1.0` and a color equal to the last color in `colors` is implied.

### `tile_mode`[​](/docs/reference/types/lineargradient#tile_mode "Direct link to tile_mode")

How this gradient should tile the plane beyond in the region before `begin` and after `end`. The value is of type [`GradientTileMode`](/docs/reference/types/gradienttilemode).

### Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/lineargradient#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/lineargradient/img/docs/controls/container/linear-gradient.png)

```
Container(    gradient=ft.LinearGradient(        begin=ft.alignment.top_center,        end=ft.alignment.bottom_center,       colors=[ft.Colors.BLUE, ft.Colors.YELLOW],    ),    width=150,    height=150,    border_radius=5,)
```

On this page

# LocaleConfiguration

### `current_locale`[​](/docs/reference/types/localeconfiguration#current_locale "Direct link to current_locale")

The current locale to be used in the application. If the provided value is not present in `supported_locales`, then this property will be set to the first item of `supported_locales` (aka `supported_locales[0]`).

Value is of type [`Locale`](/docs/reference/types/locale).

### `supported_locales`[​](/docs/reference/types/localeconfiguration#supported_locales "Direct link to supported_locales")

A list of [`Locale`](/docs/reference/types/locale)s that the app plans to support. If the provided value is `None` or list is empty, this property internally defaults to `[Locale("en", "US")]` (American English locale).

Value is of type `List[Locale]`.

[Edit this page](https://github.com/flet-dev/website/edit/main/docs/reference/types/localeconfiguration.md)

# Margin

`Margin` class has the properties to set margins for all sides of the rectangle:

### `left`[​](/docs/reference/types/margin#left "Direct link to left")

### `top`[​](/docs/reference/types/margin#top "Direct link to top")

### `right`[​](/docs/reference/types/margin#right "Direct link to right")

### `bottom`[​](/docs/reference/types/margin#bottom "Direct link to bottom")

## Helper methods[​](/docs/reference/types/margin#helper-methods "Direct link to Helper methods")

An instance of `margin.Margin` can be created via constructor with values for specific sides or created with helper methods:

### `margin.all(value)`[​](/docs/reference/types/margin#marginallvalue "Direct link to marginallvalue")

Applies the same margin to all sides.

### `margin.symmetric(vertical, horizontal)`[​](/docs/reference/types/margin#marginsymmetricvertical-horizontal "Direct link to marginsymmetricvertical-horizontal")

Applies `vertical` margin to top and bottom sides and `horizontal` margin to left and right sides.

### `margin.only(left, top, right, bottom)`[​](/docs/reference/types/margin#marginonlyleft-top-right-bottom "Direct link to marginonlyleft-top-right-bottom")

Applies margin to the specified sides.

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/margin#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/margin/img/docs/controls/container/container-margin-diagram.png)

```
container_1.margin = margin.all(10)container_2.margin = 20 # same as margin.all(20)container_3.margin = margin.symmetric(vertical=10)container_4.margin = margin.only(left=10)
```

# MapInteractionConfiguration

`MapInteractionConfiguration` class has the following properties:

### `enable_multi_finger_gesture_race`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractionconfiguration#enable_multi_finger_gesture_race "Direct link to enable_multi_finger_gesture_race")

A boolean value to enable multi-finger gesture race.

### `flags`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractionconfiguration#flags "Direct link to flags")

The interactive flags, of type [`MapInteractiveFlag`](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractiveflag).

### `pinch_move_threshold`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractionconfiguration#pinch_move_threshold "Direct link to pinch_move_threshold")

The threshold for pinch move.

### `pinch_move_win_gestures`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractionconfiguration#pinch_move_win_gestures "Direct link to pinch_move_win_gestures")

The pinch move win gestures, of type [`MapMultiFingerGesture`](/docs/reference/types/mapmultifingergesture).

### `pinch_zoom_win_gestures`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractionconfiguration#pinch_zoom_win_gestures "Direct link to pinch_zoom_win_gestures")

The pinch zoom win gestures, of type [`MapMultiFingerGesture`](/docs/reference/types/mapmultifingergesture).

### `pinch_zoom_threshold`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractionconfiguration#pinch_zoom_threshold "Direct link to pinch_zoom_threshold")

The threshold for pinch zoom, of type `OptionalNumber`.

### `rotation_threshold`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractionconfiguration#rotation_threshold "Direct link to rotation_threshold")

The threshold for rotation, of type `OptionalNumber`.

### `rotation_win_gestures`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractionconfiguration#rotation_win_gestures "Direct link to rotation_win_gestures")

The rotation win gestures, of type [`MapMultiFingerGesture`](/docs/reference/types/mapmultifingergesture).

### `scroll_wheel_velocity`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapinteractionconfiguration#scroll_wheel_velocity "Direct link to scroll_wheel_velocity")

The velocity for the scroll wheel.

On this page

# StrokePattern

`StrokePattern` is a base class for stroke patterns.

The following classes inherit from `StrokePattern`:

### `SolidStrokePattern`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapstrokepattern#solidstrokepattern "Direct link to solidstrokepattern")

A solid stroke pattern.

### `DashedStrokePattern`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapstrokepattern#dashedstrokepattern "Direct link to dashedstrokepattern")

A dash stroke pattern. It has the following properties:

-   `segments`: A list of segment lengths, which can be either floats or ints.
-   `pattern_fit`: The pattern fit strategy, of type [`PatternFit`](/docs/reference/types/mappatternfit). The default value is `PatternFit.SCALE_UP`.

### `DottedStrokePattern`[​](/docs/reference/types/mapstrokepattern#dottedstrokepattern "Direct link to dottedstrokepattern")

A dot stroke pattern. It has the following properties:

-   `spacing_factor`: The spacing factor between dots, of type `OptionalNumber`.
-   `pattern_fit`: The pattern fit strategy, of type [`PatternFit`](/docs/reference/types/mappatternfit). The default value is `PatternFit.SCALE_UP`.

[Edit this page](https://github.com/flet-dev/website/edit/main/docs/reference/types/mapstrokepattern.md)

# MenuStyle

`MenuStyle` allows controlling the menu's visual aspects, such as shape, background and shadow colors, content padding, border width and radius.

Each individual style attribute could be configured for all or particular [Material states](/docs/reference/types/controlstate) of a menu, such as `HOVERED`, `FOCUSED`, `DISABLED` and others.

`MenuStyle` class has the following properties:

### `alignment`[​](/docs/reference/types/menustyle#alignment "Direct link to alignment")

Defines the desired alignment of the submenu when opened relative to the button that opens it.

### `bgcolor`[​](/docs/reference/types/menustyle#bgcolor "Direct link to bgcolor")

The menu's background fill color.

### `elevation`[​](/docs/reference/types/menustyle#elevation "Direct link to elevation")

The elevation of the menu's Material.

### `padding`[​](/docs/reference/types/menustyle#padding "Direct link to padding")

The padding between the menu's boundary and its child.

### `shadow_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/menustyle#shadow_color "Direct link to shadow_color")

The shadow color of the menu's Material.

### `shape`[​](/docs/reference/types/menustyle#shape "Direct link to shape")

The shape of the menu's underlying Material, an instance of [`OutlinedBorder`](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder) class.

### `side`[​](/docs/reference/types/menustyle#side "Direct link to side")

An instance of [`BorderSide`](/docs/reference/types/borderside) class, the color and weight of the menu's outline.

### `surface_tint_color`[​](/docs/reference/types/menustyle#surface_tint_color "Direct link to surface_tint_color")

The surface tint color of the menu's Material.

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/menustyle#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

You can configure a different shape, background color for a `HOVERED` state and configure fallback values for all other states.

To configure style attribute for all [Material states](/docs/reference/types/controlstate), set its value to a literal ( or class instance).

For example, if you set `bgcolor` property to a literal the value will be applied to all menu states:

```
ft.MenuStyle(bgcolor=ft.Colors.RED)
```

To configure style attribute for specific Material states set its value to a dictionary where the key is state name.

For example, to configure different background colors for `HOVERED` and `FOCUSED` states and another colors for all other states:

```
ft.MenuStyle(    bgcolor={        ft.ControlState.HOVERED: ft.Colors.WHITE,        ft.ControlState.FOCUSED: ft.Colors.BLUE,        ft.ControlState.DEFAULT: ft.Colors.BLACK,    })
```
