# OutlinedBorder

An abstract class that can be used to create custom borders.

`OutlinedBorder` has the following implementations:

### `StadiumBorder`[​](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder#stadiumborder "Direct link to stadiumborder")

Creates a border that looks like a stadium.

### `RoundedRectangleBorder`[​](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder#roundedrectangleborder "Direct link to roundedrectangleborder")

Creates a border with rounded rectangle corners. It accepts the following parameters:

-   `radius` - border radius, an instance of [`BorderRadius`](/docs/reference/types/borderradius) or a number.

### `CircleBorder`[​](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder#circleborder "Direct link to circleborder")

Creates a border with a circle shape.

### `BeveledRectangleBorder`[​](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder#beveledrectangleborder "Direct link to beveledrectangleborder")

Creates a border with beveled rectangle corners. It accepts the following parameters:

-   `radius` - border radius, an instance of [`BorderRadius`](/docs/reference/types/borderradius) or a number.

### `ContinuousRectangleBorder`[​](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder#continuousrectangleborder "Direct link to continuousrectangleborder")

Creates a border with continuous rectangle corners. It accepts the following parameters:

-   `radius` - border radius, an instance of [`BorderRadius`](/docs/reference/types/borderradius) or a number.

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/outlinedborder/img/docs/controls/floatingactionbutton/fab-with-custom-shape.png)

```
import flet as ftdef main(page: ft.Page):    page.floating_action_button = ft.FloatingActionButton(        content=ft.Row(            [ft.Icon(ft.Icons.ADD), ft.Text("Add")], alignment="center", spacing=5        ),        bgcolor=ft.Colors.AMBER_300,        shape=ft.RoundedRectangleBorder(radius=5),        width=100,        mini=True,    )    page.add(ft.Text("Just a text!"))ft.app(main)
```

# Padding

Defines padding for all sides of a rectangle.

`Padding` class has the following properties:

### `left`[​](/docs/reference/types/padding#left "Direct link to left")

The padding value for the left side of the rectangle.

### `top`[​](/docs/reference/types/padding#top "Direct link to top")

The padding value for the top side of the rectangle.

### `right`[​](/docs/reference/types/padding#right "Direct link to right")

The padding value for the right side of the rectangle.

### `bottom`[​](/docs/reference/types/padding#bottom "Direct link to bottom")

The padding value for the bottom side of the rectangle.

## Helper methods[​](/docs/reference/types/padding#helper-methods "Direct link to Helper methods")

`Padding` can be created via constructor with values for specific sides or created with helper methods:

### `padding.all(value: float)`[​](/docs/reference/types/padding#paddingallvalue-float "Direct link to paddingallvalue-float")

Applies the same padding to all sides.

### `padding.symmetric(vertical, horizontal)`[​](/docs/reference/types/padding#paddingsymmetricvertical-horizontal "Direct link to paddingsymmetricvertical-horizontal")

Applies `vertical` padding to top and bottom sides and `horizontal` padding to left and right sides.

### `padding.only(left, top, right, bottom)`[​](/docs/reference/types/padding#paddingonlyleft-top-right-bottom "Direct link to paddingonlyleft-top-right-bottom")

Applies padding to the specified sides.

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/padding#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/padding/img/docs/controls/container/container-padding-diagram.png)

```
container_1.padding = ft.padding.all(10)container_2.padding = 20 # same as ft.padding.all(20)container_3.padding = ft.padding.symmetric(horizontal=10)container_4.padding=padding.only(left=10)
```

# Paint

A description of the style to use when drawing a shape on the canvas.

`Paint` class has the following properties:

### `anti_alias`[​](/docs/reference/types/paint#anti_alias "Direct link to anti_alias")

Whether to apply anti-aliasing to lines and images drawn on the canvas.

Defaults to `True`.

### `blend_mode`[​](/docs/reference/types/paint#blend_mode "Direct link to blend_mode")

A blend mode to apply when a shape is drawn or a layer is composited.

Value is of type [`BlendMode`](/docs/reference/types/blendmode) and defaults to `BlendMode.SRC_OVER`.

### `blur_image`[​](/docs/reference/types/paint#blur_image "Direct link to blur_image")

Blur image when drawing it on a canvas.

See [`Container.blur`](/docs/controls/container#blur) for more information.

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/paint#color "Direct link to color")

The [color](/docs/reference/colors) to use when stroking or filling a shape. Defaults to opaque black.

### `gradient`[​](/docs/reference/types/paint#gradient "Direct link to gradient")

Configures gradient paint. Value is an instance of one of the following classes:

-   [`PaintLinearGradient`](/docs/reference/types/paintlineargradient)
-   [`PaintRadialGradient`](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient)
-   [`PaintSweepGradient`](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient)

# PaintLinearGradient

`PaintLinearGradient` class has the following properties:

### `begin`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintlineargradient#begin "Direct link to begin")

An instance of [`Offset`](/docs/reference/types/offset). The offset at which stop 0.0 of the gradient is placed.

### `colors`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintlineargradient#colors "Direct link to colors")

The [`colors`](/docs/reference/colors) the gradient should obtain at each of the stops. This list must contain at least two colors.

If `stops` is provided, this list must have the same length as `stops`.

### `end`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintlineargradient#end "Direct link to end")

An instance of [`Offset`](/docs/reference/types/offset). The offset at which stop 1.0 of the gradient is placed.

### `stops`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintlineargradient#stops "Direct link to stops")

A list of values from `0.0` to `1.0` that denote fractions along the gradient.

If provided, this list must have the same length as `colors`. If the first value is not `0.0`, then a stop with position `0.0` and a color equal to the first color in `colors` is implied. If the last value is not `1.0`, then a stop with position `1.0` and a color equal to the last color in `colors` is implied.

### `tile_mode`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintlineargradient#tile_mode "Direct link to tile_mode")

How this gradient should tile the plane beyond in the region before `begin` and after `end`. The value is `GradientTileMode` enum with supported values: `CLAMP` (default), `DECAL`, `MIRROR`, `REPEATED`. More info [here](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/dart-ui/TileMode.html).

### `rotation`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintlineargradient#rotation "Direct link to rotation")

Rotation for the gradient, in [radians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radian), around the center-point of its bounding box.

More information on Linear gradient [here](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/dart-ui/Gradient/Gradient.linear.html).

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/paintlineargradient#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/paintlineargradient/img/docs/controls/canvas/paint-linear-gradient.png)

```
cv.Rect(    10,    10,    100,    100,    5,    ft.Paint(        gradient=ft.PaintLinearGradient(            (0, 10), (0, 100), colors=[ft.Colors.BLUE, ft.Colors.YELLOW]        ),        style=ft.PaintingStyle.FILL,    ),)
```

# PaintRadialGradient

`PaintRadialGradient` class has the following properties:

### `center`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient#center "Direct link to center")

An instance of [`Offset`](/docs/reference/types/offset) class. The center of the gradient.

### `colors`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient#colors "Direct link to colors")

The [`colors`](/docs/reference/colors) the gradient should obtain at each of the stops. This list must contain at least two colors.

If `stops` is provided, this list must have the same length as `stops`.

### `focal`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient#focal "Direct link to focal")

The focal point of the gradient. If specified, the gradient will appear to be focused along the vector from `center` to focal.

### `focal_radius`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient#focal_radius "Direct link to focal_radius")

The radius of the focal point of gradient, as a fraction of the shortest side of the paint box.

For example, if a radial gradient is painted on a box that is `100.0` pixels wide and `200.0` pixels tall, then a radius of `1.0` will place the `1.0` stop at `100.0` pixels from the focal point.

### `radius`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient#radius "Direct link to radius")

The radius of the gradient.

### `rotation`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient#rotation "Direct link to rotation")

The rotation of the gradient in [radians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radian), around the center-point of its bounding box.

### `stops`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient#stops "Direct link to stops")

A list of values from `0.0` to `1.0` that denote fractions along the gradient.

If provided, this list must have the same length as `colors`. If the first value is not `0.0`, then a stop with position `0.0` and a color equal to the first color in `colors` is implied. If the last value is not `1.0`, then a stop with position `1.0` and a color equal to the last color in `colors` is implied.

### `tile_mode`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient#tile_mode "Direct link to tile_mode")

How this gradient should tile the plane beyond in the region before `begin` and after `end`. The value is of type [`GradientTileMode`](/docs/reference/types/gradienttilemode).

More information on Radial gradient [here](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/dart-ui/Gradient/Gradient.radial.html).

## Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/paintradialgradient/img/docs/controls/canvas/paint-radial-gradient.png)

```
cv.Circle(    60,    170,    50,    ft.Paint(        gradient=ft.PaintRadialGradient(            (60, 170), 50, colors=[ft.Colors.YELLOW, ft.Colors.BLUE]        ),        style=ft.PaintingStyle.FILL,    ),)
```

# PaintSweepGradient

`PaintSweepGradient` class has the following properties:

### `center`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#center "Direct link to center")

An instance of [`Offset`](/docs/reference/types/offset) class. The center of the gradient.

### `colors`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#colors "Direct link to colors")

The [`colors`](/docs/reference/colors) the gradient should obtain at each of the stops. This list must contain at least two colors.

If `stops` is provided, this list must have the same length as `stops`.

### `end_angle`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#end_angle "Direct link to end_angle")

The angle in radians at which stop 1.0 of the gradient is placed. Defaults to math.pi \* 2.

### `rotation`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#rotation "Direct link to rotation")

The rotation of the gradient in [radians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radian), around the center-point of its bounding box.

### `start_angle`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#start_angle "Direct link to start_angle")

The angle in [radians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radian) at which stop 0.0 of the gradient is placed. Defaults to 0.0.

### `stops`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#stops "Direct link to stops")

A list of values from `0.0` to `1.0` that denote fractions along the gradient.

If provided, this list must have the same length as `colors`. If the first value is not `0.0`, then a stop with position `0.0` and a color equal to the first color in `colors` is implied. If the last value is not `1.0`, then a stop with position `1.0` and a color equal to the last color in `colors` is implied.

### `tile_mode`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#tile_mode "Direct link to tile_mode")

How this gradient should tile the plane beyond in the region before `begin` and after `end`. The value is of type [`GradientTileMode`](/docs/reference/types/gradienttilemode).

More information on Sweep gradient [here](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/dart-ui/Gradient/Gradient.sweep.html).

#### Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient/img/docs/controls/canvas/paint-sweep-gradient.png)

```
cv.Path(    [        cv.Path.MoveTo(60, 230),        cv.Path.LineTo(110, 330),        cv.Path.LineTo(10, 330),        cv.Path.Close(),    ],    ft.Paint(        gradient=ft.PaintSweepGradient(            (60, 280),            colors=[ft.Colors.YELLOW, ft.Colors.BLUE],            start_angle=0,            end_angle=math.pi * 2,        ),        stroke_width=5,        stroke_join=ft.StrokeJoin.ROUND,        style=ft.PaintingStyle.STROKE,    ),)
```

### `stroke_cap`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#stroke_cap "Direct link to stroke_cap")

The kind of finish to place on the end of lines drawn when `style` is set to `PaintingStyle.STROKE`.

The value is an instance of `ft.StrokeCap` enum:

-   `BUTT` (default) - Begin and end contours with a flat edge and no extension.
-   `ROUND` - Begin and end contours with a semi-circle extension.
-   `SQUARE` - Begin and end contours with a half square extension. This is similar to extending each contour by half the stroke width (as given by `Paint.stroke_width`).

### `stroke_join`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#stroke_join "Direct link to stroke_join")

The kind of finish to place on the joins between segments.

This applies to paths drawn when style is set to `PaintingStyle.STROKE`, It does not apply to points drawn as lines with `canvas.Points`.

Defaults to `StrokeJoin.MITER`, i.e. sharp corners.

Value is of type [`StrokeJoin`](/docs/reference/types/strokejoin).

See [StrokeJoin enum](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/dart-ui/StrokeJoin.html) in Flutter documentation for more details.

### `stroke_miter_limit`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#stroke_miter_limit "Direct link to stroke_miter_limit")

The limit for miters to be drawn on segments when the join is set to `StrokeJoin.MITER` and the style is set to `PaintingStyle.STROKE`. If this limit is exceeded, then a `StrokeJoin.BEVEL` join will be drawn instead. This may cause some 'popping' of the corners of a path if the angle between line segments is animated, as seen in the diagrams below.

This limit is expressed as a limit on the length of the miter.

Defaults to 4.0. Using zero as a limit will cause a `StrokeJoin.BEVEL` join to be used all the time.

### `stroke_width`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#stroke_width "Direct link to stroke_width")

How wide to make edges drawn when style is set to `PaintingStyle.STROKE`. The width is given in logical pixels measured in the direction orthogonal to the direction of the path.

Defaults to 0.0, which correspond to a hairline width.

### `stroke_dash_pattern`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#stroke_dash_pattern "Direct link to stroke_dash_pattern")

A circular array of dash offsets and lengths.

For example, the array `[5, 10]` would result in dashes 5 pixels long followed by blank spaces 10 pixels long. The array `[5, 10, 5]` would result in a 5 pixel dash, a 10 pixel gap, a 5 pixel dash, a 5 pixel gap, a 10 pixel dash, etc.

### `style`[​](/docs/reference/types/paintsweepgradient#style "Direct link to style")

Whether to paint inside shapes, the edges of shapes, or both.

The value is an instance of `ft.PaintingStyle` enum:

-   `FILL` (default) - Apply the `Paint` to the inside of the shape. For example, when applied to the `canvas.Circle` shape, this results in a disc of the given size being painted.
-   `STROKE` - Apply the `Paint` to the edge of the shape. For example, when applied to the `canvas.Circle` shape, this results is a hoop of the given size being painted. The line drawn on the edge will be the width given by the `Paint.stroke_width` property.

# PieChartSection

`PieChartSection` class has the following properties:

### `value`[​](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection#value "Direct link to value")

Determines how much the section should occupy. This depends on sum of all sections, each section should occupy (`value` / sum of all values) \* `360` degrees.

### `radius`[​](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection#radius "Direct link to radius")

External radius of the section.

### `color`[​](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection#color "Direct link to color")

Background [color](/docs/reference/colors) of the section.

### `border_side`[​](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection#border_side "Direct link to border_side")

The border around section shape.

Value is of type [`BorderSide`](/docs/reference/types/borderside).

### `title`[​](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection#title "Direct link to title")

A title drawn at the center of the section. No title is drawn if `title` is empty.

### `title_style`[​](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection#title_style "Direct link to title_style")

The style to draw `title` with. The value is an instance of [`TextStyle`](/docs/reference/types/textstyle) class.

### `title_position`[​](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection#title_position "Direct link to title_position")

By default title is drawn in the middle of the section, but its position can be changed with `title_position` property which value must be between `0.0` (near the center) and `1.0`(near the outside of the pie chart).

### `badge`[​](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection#badge "Direct link to badge")

An optional `Control` drawn in the middle of a section.

### `badge_position`[​](/docs/reference/types/piechartsection#badge_position "Direct link to badge_position")

By default the badge is drawn in the middle of the section, but its position can be changed with `badge_position` property which value must be between `0.0` (near the center) and `1.0`(near the outside of the pie chart).

# RadialGradient

`RadialGradient` class has the following properties:

### `colors`[​](/docs/reference/types/radialgradient#colors "Direct link to colors")

### `stops`[​](/docs/reference/types/radialgradient#stops "Direct link to stops")

### `tile_mode`[​](/docs/reference/types/radialgradient#tile_mode "Direct link to tile_mode")

How this gradient should tile the plane beyond in the region before `begin` and after `end`. The value is of type [`GradientTileMode`](/docs/reference/types/gradienttilemode).

### `rotation`[​](/docs/reference/types/radialgradient#rotation "Direct link to rotation")

The rotation of the gradient in [radians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radian), around the center-point of its bounding box.

### `center`[​](/docs/reference/types/radialgradient#center "Direct link to center")

An instance of [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment) class. The center of the gradient, as an offset into the (-1.0, -1.0) x (1.0, 1.0) square describing the gradient which will be mapped onto the paint box. For example, an alignment of (0.0, 0.0) will place the radial gradient in the center of the box.

### `radius`[​](/docs/reference/types/radialgradient#radius "Direct link to radius")

The radius of the gradient, as a fraction of the shortest side of the paint box. For example, if a radial gradient is painted on a box that is 100.0 pixels wide and 200.0 pixels tall, then a radius of 1.0 will place the 1.0 stop at 100.0 pixels from the `center`.

### `focal`[​](/docs/reference/types/radialgradient#focal "Direct link to focal")

The focal point of the gradient. If specified, the gradient will appear to be focused along the vector from `center` to focal.

### `focal_radius`[​](/docs/reference/types/radialgradient#focal_radius "Direct link to focal_radius")

The radius of the focal point of gradient, as a fraction of the shortest side of the paint box. For example, if a radial gradient is painted on a box that is 100.0 pixels wide and 200.0 pixels tall, then a radius of 1.0 will place the 1.0 stop at 100.0 pixels from the focal point.

More information on Radial gradient [here](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/painting/RadialGradient-class.html)).

### Usage example[​](/docs/reference/types/radialgradient#usage-example "Direct link to Usage example")

![](https://flet.dev/docs/reference/types/radialgradient/img/docs/controls/container/radial-gradient.png)

```
Container(    gradient=ft.RadialGradient(       colors=[ft.Colors.YELLOW, ft.Colors.BLUE],    ),    width=150,    height=150,    border_radius=5,)
```

# Rotate

`Rotate` has the following properties:

### `angle`[​](/docs/reference/types/rotate#angle "Direct link to angle")

Gives the rotation in clockwise radians.

Value is of type [`OptionalNumber`](/docs/reference/types/aliases#optionalnumber).

### `alignment`[​](/docs/reference/types/rotate#alignment "Direct link to alignment")

Defines the alignment of the rotation.

Value is of type [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment).

# Scale

`Scale` has the following properties:

### `alignment`[​](/docs/reference/types/scale#alignment "Direct link to alignment")

Gives the origin of scale.

Value is of type [`Alignment`](/docs/reference/types/alignment).

### `scale`[​](/docs/reference/types/scale#scale "Direct link to scale")

`scale_x` and `scale_y` get the value of `scale` if `scale` is provided.

Value is of type `float` and defaults to `None`.

### `scale_x`[​](/docs/reference/types/scale#scale_x "Direct link to scale_x")

The scalar by which to multiply the x-axis.

Value is of type `float` and defaults to `None`.

### `scale_y`[​](/docs/reference/types/scale#scale_y "Direct link to scale_y")

The scalar by which to multiply the y-axis.

Value is of type `float` and defaults to `None`.

[Edit this page](https://github.com/flet-dev/website/edit/main/docs/reference/types/scale.md)

On this page

# StrutStyle

`StrutStyle` class has the following properties:

### `font_family`[​](/docs/reference/types/strutstyle#font_family "Direct link to font_family")

See [`Text.font_family`](/docs/controls/text#font_family).

### `force_strut_height`[​](/docs/reference/types/strutstyle#force_strut_height "Direct link to force_strut_height")

Whether the strut height should be forced.

Defaults to `False`.

### `height`[​](/docs/reference/types/strutstyle#height "Direct link to height")

The minimum height of the strut, as a multiple of `size`.

See detailed explanation [here](https://api.flutter.dev/flutter/painting/StrutStyle/height.html).

### `italic`[​](/docs/reference/types/strutstyle#italic "Direct link to italic")

`True` to use italic typeface.

Defaults to `False`.

### `leading`[​](/docs/reference/types/strutstyle#leading "Direct link to leading")

The amount of additional space to place between lines when rendering text.

Defaults to using the font-specified leading value.

### `size`[​](/docs/reference/types/strutstyle#size "Direct link to size")

The size of text (in logical pixels) to use when getting metrics from the font.

Defaults to `14`.

### `weight`[​](/docs/reference/types/strutstyle#weight "Direct link to weight")

The typeface thickness to use when calculating the strut.

Value is of type [`FontWeight`](/docs/reference/types/fontweight) and defaults to `FontWeight.W_400`.
